programme.title: Weatherview

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Catching up with Lucy McGrath and Lee Jackson, plus twins Rosie and Jack, who spent a week in Brisbane a year ago. At the time, Lucy was determined to convince her partner that Australia was where they should be, but he and the children were reluctant to leave their lives behind in the UK

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a cottage in Cornwall, a house in Ashford, Kent, and a mid-terrace in Northumberland, before finding out who bought the properties and what they sold for at auction

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Along with experts Mark Stacey and David Harper, presenter Tim Wonnacott joins the teams in Grimsthorpe, Lincolnshire, as a newly engaged couple take on a duo who have been happily married for 43 years. They are advised and guided by experts Mark Stacey and David Harper before finding out if their items make any profit when they are sold at auction in Mackworth, Derbyshire

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces live coverage of the conclusion of the women's curling round-robin match between Great Britain and Canada at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, and updates on the women's snowboarding half-pipe discipline at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana. Coverage continues on BBC2

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara realises something about her own behaviour as she mediates between two brothers who are harbouring family resentments from the past. Elsewhere, Jimmi is troubled by some of Hermione's views, and Al's recent decisions come back to haunt him. Medical drama, starring Elisabeth Dermot Walsh, Adrian Lewis Morgan and Ian Midlane

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: WPC Gina Dawson is beginning to enjoy being undercover as Ruby, but struggles with her growing feelings for Chris. Rosie becomes increasingly horrified by what is happening at the brothel and plans to leave, but she later finds Ned beating Rebecca, so helps her to escape instead. Police drama set in the 1950s, starring Jennie Jacques and Charlie De'Ath

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family with a budget of Â£700,000 find a country retreat in Hampshire where three generations can live together. While in the county, Jules visits England's oldest almshouses

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: David Harper and Mark Stacey compete at a car-boot sale at Ford Airfield in West Sussex. They each have Â£250 to spend as they try to outdo each other and make the most profit. Plus, a look at what happens when one dealer breaks his opponent's antique

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kevin is a bag of nerves as his university bursary interview looms, despite the presence of Chalky, who has made a welcome return to support his foster son. But when the anxious student collapses and is rushed to hospital, it sends shockwaves through the school. Nikki frantically tries to keep Vix in the dark about her one-night stand with Hector, but after vindictive Gabriella finds out, she sets out to destroy her teacher's relationship, and Lula's excitement at being offered a university place is short-lived when her family is threatened with deportation

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Pete's goddaughter comes to stay from Australia, but her arrival has an unfortunate effect on the Brockman household - especially as Sue and Jake also have visitors. Meanwhile, Ben's role in Spartacus: The Musical is under threat. Family comedy, guest starring Emily Berrington (The White Queen), alongside Claire Skinner and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes looks after a robotic baby that has been given to Dermot and Maria to help them prepare for their new arrival, but uses unorthodox methods to stop the fake infant from crying. Meanwhile, Cathy develops a crush on her psychology lecturer. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the midweek Premier League matches, which include Arsenal v Manchester United at the Emirates Stadium and Manchester City v Sunderland at the Etihad Stadium. The Gunners and City were looking for home wins to boost their chances of winning the title, with the champions and the Black Cats aiming to do the double over their respective opponents. Plus, action from Cardiff City v Aston Villa, Hull City v Southampton, West Ham United v Norwich City, West Bromwich Albion v Chelsea, Everton v Crystal Palace, Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur, Stoke City v Swansea City and Fulham v Liverpool

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman returns a year later to discover whether the France-Brothertons decided to move to Australia after spending a trial week in Perth. They emigrated from South Africa to the UK in 2002 following an attack on their home, and wife Chantelle had settled into the British way of life. However, her husband Craig yearned for an outdoor lifestyle and suggested moving Down Under. During their stay in Australia, Chantelle admitted she was unsure whether she had the strength to move halfway around the world again

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a cottage in Somerset, a mid-terraced house in Chatham, Kent, and a flat in Carlisle, Cumbria. They then discover what they were sold for at auction, and learn about the buyers' plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts James Braxton and Thomas Plant help contestants find antiques in London's bustling Portobello Road, while presenter Tim Wonnacott visits the Foundling Museum, where he discovers how the works of Handel helped poor and needy children

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents coverage on day six in Russia, featuring the final of the women's 500m short track speed skating and Great Britain v USA in the men's curling. The skating at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi sees the first women's event decided, with British hopes resting on Elise Christie, while the round-robin stage at the Ice Cube Curling Centre continues, as Britain play their fifth match of the tournament. Coverage continues on BBC2

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Emma learns a valuable lesson after her old university friend Zoe turns up with the answer to all of her troubles. Meanwhile, Karen and Zara get a reality check, and Al finds himself in hot water with Howard. Medical drama, starring Dido Miles and Caroline Faber

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: DI Max Harper believes he has enough evidence to connect the murders of Rosie Turner and Daniel Pembrook. Chief Inspector Briggs is shocked to discover the extent of Sergeant Fenton's deception, and even though he reveals Lenny Powell's connection to the brothel, it does not appear to be enough to save him. Starring Ben Turner

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win Â£1,000, but only by achieving absolute perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money rolls over to create a bigger jackpot in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple of city dwellers in their search for a home in rural Wiltshire. The presenter also takes time out from the property hunt to learn about a canal restoration project

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques experts David Harper and Mark Stacey visit Chiswick Auctions in London, where they must bid wisely on goods and then attempt to sell on their purchases for the most profit, raising money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat continues her quest to find Stacey, coming face to face with a young man (guest star Matt Willis) who might just know where her cousin is. Meanwhile, Billy learns Alfie's secret and warns him to come clean to his wife, and Lucy learns a few home truths about Danny. Denise confesses her indiscretion with Fat Boy to Patrick, unaware Shabnam has overheard, and the local traders discuss their plan of action regarding the possible market closure - but Ian, who was supposed to be chairing the meeting, fails to show up

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: The daily fortunes of retail business Poundworld and its CEO Chris Edwards. The company is opening a new store in Peterborough, not far away from the city's longest-running small independent pound shop, whose owner, Zaffer Iqbal, vows to take on the newcomer. But with several chains and supermarkets already in town, is this the last straw for the small retailer? In Burnley, Poundworld assistant manager Ian Gilbert has secretly ordered a record number of cold drinks to cash in on the warm weather, but the sun hasn't materialised, so he tries to sell them off before the regional manager visits, and at the Wakefield HQ, a new CCTV system is installed to catch any light-fingered workers helping themselves to stock

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is washed up beside a pier, leading Gently and Bacchus to question the staff and guests of the nearby holiday camp where she worked. It turns out she was a popular member of staff, a charismatic performer and great with the guests - but her mother's reaction to her death makes the detectives suspect there is more to her family situation than meets the eye. And when her colleagues' alibis for the night of the murder don't quite stack up, a different picture of the victim - and the camp - comes to light. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with guest appearances from Pixie Lott, Lee Boardman, Lisa Riley and Andrea Lowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour Home Secretary Alan Johnson

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a light-hearted romp through the political and parliamentary developments of the past seven days. They will be discussing who is making the headlines and the issues that matter to both MPs and the public

programme.title: Skiing Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman catches up with the Orrett family one year on from their first meeting. Paramedic Gillian and her husband Stuart had often dreamed of emigrating, so when eldest daughter Christine moved to Perth and had the couple's first grandchild, their resolve only strengthened. Nicki finds out whether they took the plunge

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a bungalow in Derby, a two-bedroom flat in London and a semi-detached house in Cumbria, and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. After three months the team returns to review their progress

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and James Braxton assist two pairs of bargain hunters as they head to the picturesque town of Honiton in Devon, where items of interest include a mounted ostrich egg and a Victorian magic lantern. Presenter Tim Wonnacott visits Saltram House near Plymouth

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day seven in Russia, featuring the men's alpine skiing super combined slalom run and Great Britain v Japan in the women's curling. The medals are set to be decided in the skiing at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana, with the leading competitors from the downhill run looking to follow that with an impressive display in the slalom, while the Ice Cube Curling Centre is the venue as the curling round-robin stage continues. Coverage continues on BBC2

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Hermione has a few Valentine's surprises planned, but Jimmi struggles to keep up the pretence of enjoying himself when things do not go as expected. Meanwhile, there are a few shocks in store for both Karen and Valerie, and love is definitely not in the air for Rob

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Sergeant Fenton discovers a local forger making a fake passport for Lenny Powell, and gets a shock when Chris Hutton turns up at the handover. A fight between Fenton and Lenny ensues, and the latter admits he beat up the boxer, but denies killing Rosie or Daniel Pembrook. Gina's world is rocked when the murderer reveals himself, and she has to make a life-or-death decision. Police drama set in the 1950s, starring Charlie De'Ath and Michael Higgs. Last in the series

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win Â£1,000, but only by achieving absolute perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money rolls over to create a bigger jackpot in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps two retired health-care professionals find their ideal country home in Cumbria on a budget of Â£475,000. While in the area, the presenter travels to the Lyth Valley to learn about the area's damson-growing heritage

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: David Harper and Mark Stacey face the antiques showdown, making purchases at four locations before selling at least half of them at auction. In their battle for premium profits and the coveted title of champion, there are plenty of twists and turns

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Chris Evans and Alex Jones present the final show of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Everton midfielder Leon Osman, former world snooker champion Shaun Murphy, Paralympic gold medallist sprinter Richard Whitehead and ex-rugby league winger Martin Offiah join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quickfire quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is determined to go through with her plan but soon finds herself in an awkward predicament, while back at home Alfie is suspicious of her secret conversations with Max. Denise is rattled when Ian finally confronts her about what she has been up to, Danny spoils Lucy on Valentine's Day - unaware she has revenge on her mind - and an anonymous card at the Masoods' angers Shabnam. An unwell Carol wants to visit Alice, and is delighted when Tamwar offers to help

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV presenter Vernon Kay, interior designer and Dragons' Den entrepreneur Kelly Hoppen, and comedian and actor Miles Jupp compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include litter louts, toilet-roll covers and loud noises

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The veteran detectives investigate the murder of a palaeontologist at the Natural History Museum, discovering the victim was a respected but outspoken scientist with a knack for rubbing people up the wrong way. When it comes out he was strongly opposed to the museum's sponsorship deal with a large fuel company, the cops soon have plenty of suspects. Amanda Redman stars, with guest appearances by Trevor Bannister, Lucy Brown and Natasha Little

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham's guests include Hollywood actor Matt Damon, Downton Abbey's Hugh Bonneville and Bill Murray, who star in George Clooney's new Second World War movie The Monuments Men. Paloma Faith provides the music, performing her new single Can't Rely on You, and the host subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: The daily fortunes of retail business Poundworld and its CEO Chris Edwards. The company is opening a new store in Peterborough, not far away from the city's longest-running small independent pound shop, whose owner, Zaffer Iqbal, vows to take on the newcomer. But with several chains and supermarkets already in town, is this the last straw for the small retailer? In Burnley, Poundworld assistant manager Ian Gilbert has secretly ordered a record number of cold drinks to cash in on the warm weather, but the sun hasn't materialised, so he tries to sell them off before the regional manager visits, and at the Wakefield HQ, a new CCTV system is installed to catch any light-fingered workers helping themselves to stock

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Omnibus. Kat cannot shake the belief that she just saw Stacey, and persuades Alfie to cut short their reunion to go searching for her cousin. Lucy discovers Danny has been embezzling money from the Butcher's Joints accounts and Denise is uncomfortable when Ian offers Fat Boy a job at the restaurant. Nancy and Whitney sign Johnny up for an online dating website - but it seems he's not the only one looking for love when Tamwar discovers Shabnam has been speaking to a mystery man

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: James Martin is joined by chefs Alyn Williams and Martin Morales, and presents highlights from Rick Stein, Celebrity MasterChef and Exploring China with Ken Hom and Ching-He Huang. Plus, wine expert Susy Atkins chooses the most appropriate bottles to match the dishes

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Half of British families struggle to share a meal more than three times a week and yet people relish the sense of togetherness it gives them. Richard Corrigan joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to prepare a hearty chicken and crayfish pie ideal for a gathering, while drinks expert Kate Goodman comes up with ales to suit the occasion and chef Andy Bates joins the team for a debate about the future of family dining

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to the weekend's action, which includes the fifth round of the FA Cup, featuring Manchester City v Chelsea and Arsenal v Liverpool. Plus, a review of the midweek Premier League matches and a preview of the Champions League last 16

programme.title: Saturday Sportsday
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest sports news, including a look ahead to today's important fixtures and events

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Phil Jones presents coverage of the prestigious meeting from the National Indoor Arena in Birmingham. Mo Farah won the 3,000m in last year's event and a number of stars from Great Britain and abroad are expected to compete once again, including two-time Olympic champion Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce of Jamaica. Commentary by Andrew Cotter, with analysis from Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Paula Radcliffe

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the fifth round of the FA Cup, Football League and Scotland

programme.title: Reflex
programme.desc: The Dunns from Cheshire go up against the Phillipses from Cardiff in the game show that pits two families against each other in a series of physical and mental challenges designed to test human speed and reaction, with the fastest team going through for the chance to win Â£20,000. Hosted by Shane Richie, with Radio 2 DJ Ken Bruce commentating on the action

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts a charity edition featuring contestants from the sporting world. The pairs are former rugby player Martin Offiah and one-time cricketer Phil Tufnell, ex-footballers Mark Bright and Martin Peters, Team GB gold medal-winners Samantha Murray and Pete Reed, and snooker player John Parrott with sports presenter Hazel Irvine. All are hoping to think of the answers no one else could come up with and win big for their chosen charities. Richard Osman co-hosts

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The coaches won't be turning their backs on the acts for much longer as it's the penultimate week of blind auditions. At the end of last week, Kylie Minogue had a team of 10, while her male competitors had either seven or eight each. However, there is still some way to go, so until they all have the 12 singers they require, expect more Aussie expertise from Kylie, wise words from Ricky Wilson, name dropping from Tom Jones and crazy talk from Will.i.am as the quartet compete for the attention of each singer. Emma Willis and Marvin Humes are backstage with the contestants' families

programme.title: The National Lottery
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the game show in which two pairs of strangers team up, each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get the chance to play for Â£100,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up. Includes the Lotto and Thunderball draws presented by Gaby Roslin

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Warehouse worker Amy panics after finding an engagement ring in boyfriend Bobby's pocket and tries to avoid an awkward situation by creating a diversion at work - only to cause a fire instead. And when Bobby runs into the building in search of his girlfriend, Iain defies orders by rushing after him. Elsewhere, Lily steps into the breach as a magician's assistant when his usual partner is injured in a fall, Cal is furious to learn his late mother has given Ethan responsibility for his share of the inheritance and Zoe faces the prospect of losing a member of the team

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy seems reluctant to reveal any information about her new boyfriend, Mark refuses to talk about why his wife has thrown him out, and Dermot lies to his fiancee's parents about his job - all of which makes Agnes feel her family is becoming too secretive. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Eddie Izzard hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of stream-of-consciousness humour before introducing routines by The Last Leg star Josh Widdicombe and South African comic Trevor Noah

programme.title: The Football League Show
programme.desc: Manish Bhasin presents highlights and all the goals from today's fixtures in the Championship, League One and League Two, including, including Bournemouth v Burnley at Dean Court, as Cherries manager Eddie Howe faced his promotion-chasing former club. Plus, action from Watford v Middlesbrough

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Wigan Warriors v Huddersfield Giants. Tanya Arnold presents highlights of the opening fixture of the season at the DW Stadium. This match saw the champions begin the defence of their title at home to the side that finished top of the regular standings at the end of the last campaign. Plus, a profile of all 14 clubs and how they are expected to fare this season

programme.title: Inspire
programme.desc: Magazine series presented by Gabby Logan, taking an in-depth look at the stories behind the sports and focusing on promising and high-profile sportsmen and women

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster joins a team of historians and geologists to recreate a pioneering 280-mile journey through the natural wonder that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Following in Powell's footsteps in the stunning yet challenging north Arizona landscape, Snow and the crew take on the area's rapids in antique wooden boats as they learn about the region's geological and Native American past

programme.title: Vultures
programme.desc: Cameraman and naturalist Charlie Hamilton James travels to eastern Africa to try to show a different side to the much-maligned vulture, which he believes is a beautiful and intelligent bird that deserves respect. He reveals not only a softer, more caring side to the species, but also finds evidence that a carcass was deliberately poisoned and laid out for the raptors to feed on, resulting in numerous deaths

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - One Hundred Years of the Women's Movement
programme.desc: Radio 1 DJ Gemma Cairney embarks on a personal journey through the history of the women's movement, investigating landmark events such as winning the right to vote and the sexual revolution of the 1960s

programme.title: Fit to Rule
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley presents six short films examining the impact the mental and physical health of monarchs, including Henry VIII, Edward VI, Mary I, Charles I and George III, has had on history. She also explores how childbirth has always been one of the royal family's greatest biological challenges

programme.title: Schools - True Stories
programme.desc: Part one of two. The stories of 10 people who changed the world, beginning with Florence Nightingale, Alexander Graham Bell, Harriet Tubman, Isambard Kingdom Brunel and Mary Anning

programme.title: Schools - Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: Footage of knot birds flying in formation over the sea. Documentary series comprising 20 short films celebrating wildlife and the natural world. Using beautiful imagery and inspiring music, each explores a particular theme

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage from Russia on day five of the Games, including downhill alpine skiing, ice hockey and curling. The Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana is the first port of call at 7.00 for the latest event from the alpine skiing schedule, as the medals are decided in the women's downhill. The absence through injury of defending champion Lindsey Vonn is something of a blow to the prestige of the competition, but a high-quality field will be looking to succeed the American and write a new chapter of Olympic history. Action from yesterday's ski jumping and figure skating follows at 8.00, with the women's ice hockey group fixture between Finland and Switzerland from 9.00 at the Shayba Arena in Sochi, and women's curling at 10.00 from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, where the round-robin stage continues with the match between Great Britain and Canada. This represents a tough test for Eve Muirhead and her squad, with Canada finishing as runners-up four years ago after topping the standings during the round-robin phase. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day five in Russia, featuring Nordic Combined skiing highlights, and live ice hockey, curling and speed skating. The men's Nordic Combined individual 10km Gundersen event starts the programme at 1.00 at the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana, with action from the ski jump and cross-country elements of the sport. Live ice hockey coverage gets under way at 1.30 at the Shayba Arena in Sochi, joining the women's group match between the USA and Canada in progress, with both sides aiming to book a place in the semi-finals. That is followed at 3.00 by the men's curling round-robin match between Great Britain and Switzerland at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, as the race to qualify for the last four continues, interspersed with the men's 1,000m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in the same city

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage through to the end of the fifth day of the Games in Russia, including live luge, figure skating and curling. The Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana is the first port of call at 4.00 for the second and concluding run in the luge doubles final, where Germany will be looking to end their recent gold medal drought, having traditionally dominated the discipline. Attention then returns to the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi for the conclusion of the men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and Switzerland at 4.30, before the figure skating at 5.15 ends the day's live coverage. The Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi is the venue as the medals are decided in the pairs' free programme, with the leading couples from yesterday's short discipline battling it out to succeed Chinese duo Shen Xue and Zhao Hongbo as champions, and there will be high hopes of a home victory given Russia's strength in the sport. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day five in Russia, where six gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. The women's snowboarding half-pipe final was one of the day's key events at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, with Australia's Torah Bright looking to successfully retain the title she won in Vancouver in 2010. Alpine skiing, figure skating, speed skating, Nordic Combined skiing and luge were the other sports to see medals decided, with much of the focus being on Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort for the women's alpine skiiing downhill discipline. Lindsey Vonn was denied the chance to defend her crown as she succumbed to a knee injury that has troubled her for some time, leaving the field wide open in one of the Games' pivotal events

programme.title: The Restaurant Man
programme.desc: Russell Norman comes to the aid of Debbie Quinn, who has sunk her retirement nest egg into opening a Swedish diner in Macclesfield, Cheshire.Â He is adamant she needs to stop treating her restaurant as a hobby and start thinking like a professional, and is shocked to find that she has no head for figures at all. As launch night looms, Debbie is running out of money, hasn't thought about her service and has done no marketing. Will Russell be able to help her make the business a success?

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: New series. The return of the crime thriller about a police anti-corruption unit. DI Lindsay Denton is the sole survivor of the ambush of a police convoy in which three of her colleagues are killed and a witness is seriously injured. AC-12's commanding officer Ted Hastings assigns new recruit Georgia Trotman to work alongside Steve Arnott on the investigation, and suspicions are soon raised about Denton. Starring Adrian Dunbar, Keeley Hawes, Martin Compston and Jessica Raine

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Gerald and Sabrina's modernist home has lots of beautiful things in it of extremely high value. So when cat-burglars Ray and Eddie decide to break into the luxury house, they have to dodge all manner of obstacles - including the warring couple who live there - to get their hands on a priceless painting. Starring Denis Lawson and Oona Chaplin

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A chance to catch up with two children aged 10 who are both hard of hearing and have been monitored by the programme since they were five. Aidan previously suffered with speech dyspraxia but has now caught up and his hearing has improved following a second cochlear implant, and Amie's schoolwork continues to get better after having received the same help. With voiceover

programme.title: Dolphins - Spy in the Pod
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary taking an intimate look at the world of the marine mammal, one of the most captivating and intelligent creatures on the planet, using camcorders attached to fast-moving submersibles to record life in the oceans. The man-made `spies' swim alongside bottlenoses and a megapod of spinner dolphins, filming behaviour rarely seen before, such as a newborn and his mother hunting kingfish, while nearby males play chicken with supertankers, visit a coral health spa and surf the waves. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: Children's Emergency Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary following a team of doctors and nurses caring for some of the UK's sickest children and infants as they are transported to specialist centres around the country. Flying doctor Hazel Talbot scrambles an RAF rescue helicopter to take a 13-year-old patient from Leeds to London for a life-saving heart transplant. Narrated by Fiona Bruce

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Wonders of Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Professor Brian Cox explores how Earth became host to the natural world evident today

programme.title: Wonders of Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professor Brian Cox reveals how life is shaped by both the environment and the laws of nature

programme.title: Schools - William Whiskerson
programme.desc: The mouse explorer goes fishing for mackerel to cook at a restaurant

programme.title: Schools - William Whiskerson
programme.desc: William meets Sophie and Cameron in Lyme Regis, where they learn about fossils. They then visit the museum where they see a dinosaur skeleton

programme.title: Schools - William Whiskerson
programme.desc: William visits his friend Ewan in an eco-village and learns how its houses have been adapted to save energy. They then visit an allotment, where they pick vegetables

programme.title: Schools - William Whiskerson
programme.desc: William travels to Scotland to meet his friend Euan. They journey to the top of a mountain and learn about the wildlife that lives there, before visiting a power station

programme.title: Wonders of Nature - Emperor Penguin - Caring
programme.desc: Short film showing an emperor penguin egg as it hatches in the harsh climactic conditions of Antarctica

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces live coverage of the opening events on the sixth day in Russia, featuring curling, freestyle skiing, skeleton, ice hockey and short track speed skating. A packed schedule gets under way at the Ice Cube Curling Centre at 5.00 with the women's round-robin match between Great Britain and China, followed by qualifying for the men's freestyle skiing slopestyle discipline at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, where Britain's James Woods is looking to become the inaugural champion. The opening skeleton event of the Games starts at 7.30 at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana, as Shelley Rudman and Lizzy Yarnold compete for Britain in the opening run of the women's discipline, with the second run at 8.50. With commentary from Paul Dickenson and Colin Bryce. Between the skeleton sessions at 8.15 there will be live coverage of an ice hockey group match, and there is also coverage of the final of the men's freestyle skiing slopestyle at 9.15, with curling and short track speed skating to conclude the programme from 10.40. The curling features the men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and the USA, while at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, the women's 500m semi-finals take place, with British interest resting on the shoulders of Elise Christie. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces live coverage of the opening events on the sixth day in Russia, featuring curling, freestyle skiing, skeleton, ice hockey and short track speed skating. A packed schedule gets under way at the Ice Cube Curling Centre at 5.00 with the women's round-robin match between Great Britain and China, followed by qualifying for the men's freestyle skiing slopestyle discipline at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, where Britain's James Woods is looking to become the inaugural champion. The opening skeleton event of the Games starts at 7.30 at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana, as Shelley Rudman and Lizzy Yarnold compete for Britain in the opening run of the women's discipline, with the second run at 8.50. With commentary from Paul Dickenson and Colin Bryce. Between the skeleton sessions at 8.15 there will be live coverage of an ice hockey group match, and there is also coverage of the final of the men's freestyle skiing slopestyle at 9.15, with curling and short track speed skating to conclude the programme from 10.40. The curling features the men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and the USA, while at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, the women's 500m semi-finals take place, with British interest resting on the shoulders of Elise Christie. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day six in Russia, featuring cross-country skiing and ice hockey highlights, plus live speed skating and biathlon. The key moments in the women's 10km classic cross-country race from the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex in Krasnaya Polyana are at 1.00, followed by action from a men's ice hockey group match in Sochi at 2.00, as Russia face Slovakia and Slovenia take on the USA, with places in the quarter-finals set to be confirmed. Live coverage starts at 3.00 with the conclusion of the women's 1,000m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in Sochi, and then the focus switches back to Krasnaya Polyana as the medals are decided in the men's 20km biathlon individual discipline

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces the concluding coverage on day six in Russia, featuring the team luge relay final in Krasnaya Polyana and the men's figure skating short programme in Sochi. The luge at the Sliding Centre Sanki is first up at 4.15, with the team relay being afforded Olympic status for the first time, and also deciding the final luge medals of the Games. One individual male and one female competitor, as well as a doubles team, will represent each nation, with Germany regarded as the clear favourites for gold. At 5.20 attention shifts to the Iceberg Skating Palace for the figure skating, as the men look to put themselves in contention for victory ahead of tomorrow's concluding free programme. American Evan Lysacek took gold four years ago in Vancouver, but misses out this time due to injury, with the likes of three-time world champion Patrick Chan of Canada among the favourites to take his crown. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day six in Russia, where six gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Great Britain have taken a highly regarded squad to the Games and this was set to be a key day in defining their fortunes, with a number of potential medal hopes in action. Shelley Rudman and Lizzy Yarnold began their campaigns in the women's luge, with the first two runs taking place today, ahead of tomorrow's climax, as the quest to succeed Amy Williams as champion got under way in Krasnaya Polyana. James Woods was aiming to win the inaugural staging of the men's freestyle skiing slopestyle discipline at an Olympic Games at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park, and Elise Christie was an outside hope for a medal in the women's 500m short track speed skating in Sochi

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Asian Adventure
programme.desc: New series. Dave Myers and Si King travel around Asia exploring the roots of some of their favourite dishes from the continent. They begin in Hong Kong, where they learn about the versatility of the wok in Cantonese cuisine at a street-food stall, while breakfast reveals a surprising legacy of British rule, before the duo are sent on their way with a traditional Chinese good luck ceremony

programme.title: Bible Hunters
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary telling the stories of the dedicated men and women who travelled across Egypt in the 19th and early 20th centuries looking to unearth the earliest Christian texts. Their discoveries shed new light on the origins of Christianity and the story of the Bible

programme.title: Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe
programme.desc: Highlights from the show in which the writer and broadcaster offers a satirical look at the latest news from politics, the media and the internet, casting a critical eye over trends in TV, cinema, computer games and social media. Featuring contributions by regular commentators Barry and Philomena, as well as American stand-up Doug Stanhope. Last in the series

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines why the most intelligent animals on the planet are also the most social. Swimming with a pod of dolphins in the Bahamas, he explores their language and learns how they are able to recognise themselves in a mirror. He also witnesses the deviousness of chimpanzees and watches elephants as they mourn their dead. Last in the series

programme.title: The Review Show
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark and guests Paul Morley, Mark Ravenhill and Denise Mina review Martin Scorsese's latest film The Wolf of Wall Street and cycling documentary The Armstrong Lie, which have both been nominated for Baftas. An exhibition of work by Turner Prize winner Martin Creed is previewed, gender politics comes under the spotlight in an all-female production of Blurred Lines at the National Theatre, and there is a discussion on Stewart Foster's debut novel We Used to Be Kings. With music by Icelandic singer-songwriter Ãsgeir

programme.title: Immigration Undercover
programme.desc: An investigation into Britain's multimillion-pound trade in immigration visas that allow bogus students, some with little or no English, to remain in the UK and work illegally. Richard Watson exposes the fraudulent processes involved, from forging documents such as bank statements to getting fake sitters to take exams in place of the sham students

programme.title: Inspire
programme.desc: Magazine series presented by Gabby Logan, taking an in-depth look at the stories behind the sports and focusing on promising and high-profile sportsmen and women

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon follows in the footsteps of travellers who made long, arduous and dangerous journeys to reach Jerusalem, where every year millions of Christians, Jews and Muslims still go to worship. In the Old City, he joins in the ancient ritual of walking along the Via Dolorosa, the route taken by Jesus as He carried the cross to the site of His crucifixion. Last in the series

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - Why the Industrial Revolution Happened Here
programme.desc: Jeremy Black examines one of the most extraordinary periods in English history, explaining the unique economic, social and political conditions that led to the nation becoming the richest and most powerful on Earth by the 19th century. He traces the unprecedented explosion of new ideas and technological inventions that transformed an agrarian society into an increasingly industrial and urbanised one

programme.title: Schools - L8R Youngers 2
programme.desc: Short dramas about the journey from primary to secondary school, helping youngsters identify the issues they are likely to be faced with as they grow up. The transition is mixed with difficult realities, but a growing maturity means they learn to support each other and think about the future in new ways

programme.title: Schools - Cracking the Code
programme.desc: Science explorer Minna Kane and her team of hackers explore the world of computer programming, and meet the visual-effects artists who work on TV programme Doctor Who, test out Formula One racing simulators and play football with robots. Back in the classroom, Minna tries out a range of virtual activities linked to these real-world adventures

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage on day seven of the Games in Russia, featuring live alpine skiing and curling, and highlights of the men's ice hockey. The alpine skiing at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana is the setting for the day's first action at 7.00, as the men's super combined discipline gets under way with the downhill run, with the concluding slalom event to follow at 11.45. The men's ice hockey continues at 8.30 at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, as the Czech Republic face Latvia in the group stage, and there is women's curling at 10.00 from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in the same city, as Great Britain and Japan meet in their latest round-robin fixture. Coverage continues on BBC1

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents the latest from day seven of the Games in Russia, featuring live curling and ice hockey, and freestyle skiing, skeleton and biathlon updates. The men's ice hockey starts the coverage at 1.00 with the men's group match between Sweden and Switzerland at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, with updates on the women's aerials freestyle skiing qualifiers at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana, and the first and second runs in the men's skeleton at the Sliding Centre Sanki. Then from 3.00 attention switches to the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi for the latest men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and Denmark, with updates on the conclusion of the women's 15km individual biathlon discipline at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex in Krasnaya Polyana

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces the concluding coverage on day seven in Russia, featuring live skeleton, curling and figure skating. Hopes of British success will be high this afternoon at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana, as the women's skeleton continues for Shelley Rudman and Lizzy Yarnold, with the third run at 3.40 and the fourth and concluding run at 5.00. Amy Williams won gold for Britain four years ago in Vancouver, and both Rudman and Yarnold have been among the leading competitors this season. In between the two runs at 4.30 there is live coverage from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, where the men's round-robin match between Great Britain and Denmark is set to reach a conclusion. To complete the day's events, attention shifts to the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi at 6.00, and the climax of the men's free programme, with the leading skaters from yesterday's short discipline battling it out for the medals. Analysis of the skeleton comes from Amy Williams, with Paul Dickenson and Colin Bryce in the commentary box. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day seven in Russia, where six gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. One of those golds in particular was of great interest to the British team, as Shelley Rudman and Lizzy Yarnold competed in the women's skeleton, with both considered serious contenders. With Amy Williams having won Britain's only gold of the Vancouver Games four years ago in the same event, the duo were looking for a remarkable continuation of that success, with the third and fourth runs taking place this afternoon. Among the other highlights today were the men's super combined alpine skiing, the women's freestyle skiing aerials final and the conclusion of the men's free figure skating programme as the first week of the Games drew to a close

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to take their place in the black chair, where they answer questions on punk music between 1976 and 1979, the history of Rhodesia from 1965-1980, the plays of Samuel Beckett and French wines of the Rhone valley. They then have a chance to demonstrate their general knowledge in the final round

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: Members of the volunteer fire brigade, led by farmer and church organist Kevin Adams, get a weekend of training down at the harbour. There is also a lot of charity fundraising going on, from Zoe Adams' famous jumble sales to a calendar featuring Sark's emergency services personnel as they've never been seen before

programme.title: Mock the Week Looks Back at Health
programme.desc: A selection from the show's archives on the theme of health, including another chance to hear about Dara O Briain's curious exercise regimen, Frankie Boyle describing `Mock the Week slash fiction' and the show's producer plaintively pleading with Dara through his earpiece. Plus, appearances by panellists including Russell Howard, Andy Parsons, Micky Flanagan, Greg Davies and Michael McIntyre

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a special edition that poses questions on all manner of inventions, including some that proved to be `just the job'. Trying to come up with interesting answers are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson, comedian Jason Manford, broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies

programme.title: Alan Davies Apres-Ski
programme.desc: The comedian and a selection of guests from the worlds of comedy, entertainment and sport take an irreverent look at all the news and action from the Winter Olympics in Sochi, celebrating what makes the Games special

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Before Sunrise (1995)
programme.desc: American tourist Jesse and French student Celine meet by chance on a train travelling to Vienna. The two strangers form a close connection almost instantly, and spend the day together in the city, discussing their hopes and dreams. However, their romance seems likely to only last a day, as Jesse is due to fly back home. Richard Linklater's romantic drama, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include former Labour Home Secretary Alan Johnson

programme.title: Inspire
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents a Winter Olympics special, previewing the Games in Sochi, including a visit to Scotland to spend a day with the women's Team GB curling squad. Steve Cram travels to Norway to meet British cross-country skier Andrew Musgrave, and there is a focus on Britain's bobsleigh team, which will be led by John Jackson following his remarkable return from injury

programme.title: Steve McQueen
programme.desc: In the wake of the release of Bafta-nominated film 12 Years a Slave, Mark Kermode examines the history and culture of slavery. Director Steve McQueen chats about the making of the movie, which is based on the true story of Solomon Northup, who was sold into slavery in the 1840s, as well as his life and works

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening events on day eight in Russia, featuring live curling, alpine skiing, ice hockey and short track speed skating. The Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi is the destination at 5.00 for the women's round-robin match between Great Britain and South Korea, followed by alpine skiing from 6.50 at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana. The women's Super-G discipline is the focus of attention, with the competitors looking to succeed Austria's Andrea Fischbacher as champion. Ice hockey follows from Sochi at 8.00, featuring either the men's group match between Slovakia and Slovenia, or the women's play-off quarter-final, before a return to the curling for the men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and Olympic champions Canada at 10.00. The final action of the session comes from the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, as the short track speed skating women's 1500m and men's 1,000m disciplines build to a climax, with the respective finals at 12.06 and 12.20

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening events on day eight in Russia, featuring live curling, alpine skiing, ice hockey and short track speed skating. The Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi is the destination at 5.00 for the women's round-robin match between Great Britain and South Korea, followed by alpine skiing from 6.50 at the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana. The women's Super-G discipline is the focus of attention, with the competitors looking to succeed Austria's Andrea Fischbacher as champion. Ice hockey follows from Sochi at 8.00, featuring either the men's group match between Slovakia and Slovenia, or the women's play-off quarter-final, before a return to the curling for the men's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and Olympic champions Canada at 10.00. The final action of the session comes from the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, as the short track speed skating women's 1500m and men's 1,000m disciplines build to a climax, with the respective finals at 12.06 and 12.20

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day eight in Russia, featuring live ice hockey, speed skating, curling and skeleton. The group stage of the men's ice hockey continues at 12.30 at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi with the mouthwatering clash between Russia and the USA, as both nations look to make their progression to the latter rounds as comfortable as possible. Commentary comes from Seth Bennett and Brent Pope. Coverage at 2.50 is split between the men's 1500m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in Sochi and the women's round-robin curling fixture between Great Britain and Switzerland at the Ice Cube Curling Centre across the Olympic Park, with the curling also covered at 3.45. The concluding skeleton action of the Games is featured from 3.15 at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana, in the third and penultimate run of the men's singles, and the medals will be decided at 4.05 in the fourth run

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding takes over to present the concluding coverage on day eight in Russia, with skeleton, curling and ski jumping the three sports taking place. The immediate interest is at the Sliding Centre Sanki near Krasnaya Polyana, where the fourth and final run in the men's singles skeleton continues, with the medals set to be decided as the leading contenders take to their boards. Attention switches to the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi at 4.50 for the concluding ends of the women's round-robin fixture between Great Britain and Switzerland, with both nations having just two further matches to play in their quest to reach the semi-finals. The final coverage of the day is at the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana from 5.30, where the men's Large Hill individual ski jumping medals are up for grabs, in an event won four years ago by Switzerland's Simon Ammann. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day eight in Russia, where seven gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Two of those medals were handed out at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, in the women's 1500m and men's 1,000m short track speed skating finals, while alpine skiing, cross-country skiing, skeleton, speed skating and ski jumping were the other sports to have disciplines come to a conclusion. As well as new Olympic champions being crowned, there was likely to be a fevered atmosphere at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, as the USA and Russia continued their ice hockey schedule with an eagerly anticipated group match, while the round-robin stage of the curling continued with Great Britain's men's and women's squads in action at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: True Grit (2010)
programme.desc: Premiere. A farmer is murdered by a hired hand, who flees into the wilderness. The dead man's strong-willed 14-year-old daughter is determined to bring the killer to justice, and recruits the aid of a hard-drinking, one-eyed marshal to help her track him down. The Coen brothers' Western based on Charles Portis' novel, with Jeff Bridges, Hailee Steinfeld, Matt Damon and Josh Brolin

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the peculiar panel quiz, and finds out how much Rob Brydon, Phill Jupitus, regular panellist Alan Davies and New Zealand comedienne Cal Wilson know about journeys

programme.title: The Notorious Bettie Page (2005)
programme.desc: Biographical drama about the life of 1950s pin-up model Bettie Page. After a troubled childhood, she is first propelled into the public eye when she poses for an amateur photographer. The pictures come to the attention of famed brother-and-sister publishers the Klaws, who persuade her to take part in racier bondage photoshoots - which create scandal and provoke the wrath of a conservative senator. With Gretchen Mol, David Strathairn and Lili Taylor

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective with panellists Kaye Adams, Myleene Klass, Janet Street-Porter and Linda Robson

programme.title: Daybreak
programme.desc: Getting On and The Thick of It star Joanna Scanlan talks about appearing in the 100th episode of Midsomer Murders and playing the wife of Charles Dickens in Ralph Fiennes' The Invisible Woman, with Matt Barbet, Ranvir Singh, Lorraine Kelly and Aled Jones

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Hollywood star Matt Damon drops in to talk about his latest role in George Clooney's new film The Monuments Men. Plus, entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Consumer expert Alice Beer has more useful advice, and former TOWIE star Lydia Bright shows viewers her wardrobe. Plus, more celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines, viewers' comments in the Hub and a recipe in the kitchen, presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. programme.title: Britain's Best Bakery
programme.desc: The first of a three-day grand final sees judges Mich Turner and Peter Sidwell upping the stakes for the remaining three bakeries with the Market Challenge. The establishments are challenged to create a range of goods to sell to lunchtime shoppers at London's historic Old Spitalfields Market. No one will be leaving the competition today, but the judges will be watching closely to see who excels at turning their baking into cash

They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Still unable to tell Eric the truth, Val is heartbroken to learn he's divorcing her, and her silence pushes him into the arms of Diane. Ruby is appalled to find the hidden camera, believing Bob is trying to catch her out, while Chas returns to the village and promptly arranges a date with James. Bernice ignores Rodney's advice to take things slowly with Anton

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Simon is upset to learn that Tina is moving away, and when Peter bumps into her, he begs her not to leave. Fiz and Anna decide to set up a search party to find Roy, while Dennis tries to apologise to Rita for the awful things he said, but she's too hurt to listen. Todd lies to Marcus about having spoken to his estate agent friend, and Lloyd is in seventh heaven when he receives a text from Andrea ending with four kisses

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Midsomer resident and biscuit factory boss Eric Calder leads Barnaby and Nelson to Copenhagen. The pair join forces with local female detectives Birgitte Poulsen and Anna Degn in the hunt for the killer, and during the course of their investigation they discover the businessman had numerous links to the capital. Anglo-Danish collaboration marking Midsomer's 100th episode, guest starring Ann Eleonora Jorgensen (The Killing), Birgitte Hjort Sorensen (Borgen), Sanjeev Bhaskar and Joanna Scanlan, alongside Neil Dudgeon and Gwilym Lee. Last in the series

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Victoria is taken aback to find Val packing and begs Diane to stop her from leaving, leading to a revelation about Ian and the HIV - which leaves Diane feeling very guilty after her night with Eric. Ruby goes to Bob with footage of Brenda stealing a scarf, while Jimmy and Nicola return home to find their house has been burgled and Bernice calling out for help from the bedroom

programme.title: Can We Trust the Police?
programme.desc: Fiona Foster investigates the extent to which public confidence in the police has changed following a succession of damaging allegations and revelations, from `Plebgate' to doubts about the accuracy of crime figures. She speaks to people who feel they have been failed by the force and looks at what some constabularies are doing to regain trust, including the use of body cameras in Hampshire and the setting up of a residents' panel in Avon and Somerset

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane encourages Val to get tested and tell Eric, but she's secretly shaken by what the news could mean for her following her one-night stand. Bob confronts Brenda over the video footage, Chas lets herself grow closer to James, despite having been warned off him, and Bernice feels humiliated as she relays her version of events with Anton to the police

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey, Sharon and Dorien lose their jobs and face a financial crisis, leading to a big argument in which several home truths are revealed. However, Garth and Marcie's pub has launched successfully, thanks to a mystery celebrity endorsement, which could help solve their problems

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: The CEO of the Solana Hotel Group (guest star Joan Collins) tells Joyce to downgrade the resort to its original three-star status, and she agrees, but not before she's made sure Cyril's reputation remains untarnished. Meanwhile, Donald and Jacqueline's old friend Queenie (Rustie Lee) is in town for a party with the local swingers' association and arranges for Donald to meet his all-time hero Pepe Le Cruz and his wife Agnes (The Krankies). Pedalo-hire girl Elena comes looking for Michael, and Kenneth has an unexpected visitor at the salon. Last in the series

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: A look back at the August 1963 Royal Mail train heist, featuring interviews with key figures including Ronnie Biggs' ex-wife Charmian, relatives of the robbers, and the police officers who discovered the gang's hideout at Leatherslade Farm. The programme looks at how some media reports led to a popular perception of the culprits as folk heroes and considers the long-term impact the crime had on them

Cain manipulates James into going on a business trip to France to keep him away from Chas

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tina secretly arranges to spend the evening with Peter, only to overhear Carla talking about whisking her husband away to Paris as a romantic surprise. Anna receives a Valentine's card and suspects it is from Phelan, while Todd offers to babysit for Marcus and Maria - but Eileen is wary of her son's true motives. Gloria fumes when Rita forgives Dennis, and Kal and Dev shake hands on the gym conversion deal with Jason

programme.title: Student Nurses
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following men and women at different stages of their nursing training in Birmingham and Manchester, revealing the pressures, emotions and challenges they face, both in the classrooms and on the wards. In this edition, 24-year-old Alistair experiences first-day nerves, 21-year-old Helen nears the end of a demanding three-year degree to become a children's nurse, and mature student Dany, 50, deals with an ailing patient

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: After a passionate evening on the sofa, Peter promises Tina they'll sneak as much time together as they can, and hands her a set of keys to his flat. Phelan continues to flirt with Anna over dinner - will she tell Owen about the unwanted attention from his business partner? Maria rushes home when Todd interrupts her meal with Marcus on the pretext of Liam having a bad dream, leaving the two men alone. Meanwhile, Tony and Eva are adamant Jason should negotiate a better rate of pay for the work on the gym, and Gloria lets slip to Rita that Dennis spent the night with her

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The former cricketer joins Piers to discuss his life and career as one of Britain's most successful and controversial sportsmen. He looks back at the heroic 1981 Ashes win, speaks about sex and drug allegations against him, and opens up about the two-year affair that nearly cost him his marriage. Ian also recalls the occasion when, after a night on the tiles, he went out to bat - without a bat. Last in the series

programme.desc: Profile of the comedian who, along with Eric Morecambe, made up popular double act Morecambe and Wise. With contributions by Ernie's friends, family and co-stars

programme.desc: James Bond is sent on a mission to uncover the truth behind the disappearances of Soviet and American space capsules before the mutually suspicious superpowers go to war. programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester City v Chelsea (Kick-off 5.15pm). Adrian Chiles presents coverage of the fifth-round encounter at the Etihad Stadium. This is the second meeting here between the two in the last fortnight, and Chelsea recorded a 1-0 win when the sides last faced each other in the Premier League. The Blues also have the best pedigree of all clubs in the FA Cup in recent years, but the Citizens will be determined to earn revenge as they continue their bid for an unprecedented quadruple. With commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend, and analysis from Roy Keane and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Splash!
programme.desc: Vernon Kay and Gabby Logan present the all-male final of the celebrity diving competition, as Diversity dancer Perri Kiely, Boyzone's Keith Duffy, Paralympian Richard Whitehead and TOWIE star Dan Osborne attempt to somersault, twist and pike their way to victory with the help of their coach, Olympic bronze medallist Tom Daley. Comedienne Jo Brand and experts Leon Taylor and Andy Banks pass comment as usual, but who wins is entirely in the hands of viewers. Last in the series

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The love lift delivers a London rugby player, a physiotherapist from Liverpool, a gymnastics coach from Bath and a Glasgow drainage engineer, all of whom are hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents

programme.title: Can We Trust the Police?
programme.desc: Fiona Foster investigates the extent to which public confidence in the police has changed following a succession of damaging allegations and revelations, from `Plebgate' to doubts about the accuracy of crime figures. She speaks to people who feel they have been failed by the force and looks at what some constabularies are doing to regain trust, including the use of body cameras in Hampshire and the setting up of a residents' panel in Avon and Somerset

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane encourages Val to get tested and tell Eric, but she's secretly shaken by what the news could mean for her following her one-night stand. Maria rushes home when Todd interrupts her meal with Marcus on the pretext of Liam having a bad dream, leaving the two men alone. Ian also recalls the occasion when, after a night on the tiles, he went out to bat - without a bat. Last in the series

With contributions by Ernie's friends, family and co-stars

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester City v Chelsea (Kick-off 5.15pm). Adrian Chiles presents coverage of the fifth-round encounter at the Etihad Stadium. This is the second meeting here between the two in the last fortnight, and Chelsea recorded a 1-0 win when the sides last faced each other in the Premier League. The Blues also have the best pedigree of all clubs in the FA Cup in recent years, but the Citizens will be determined to earn revenge as they continue their bid for an unprecedented quadruple. With commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend, and analysis from Roy Keane and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Splash!
programme.desc: Vernon Kay and Gabby Logan present the all-male final of the celebrity diving competition, as Diversity dancer Perri Kiely, Boyzone's Keith Duffy, Paralympian Richard Whitehead and TOWIE star Dan Osborne attempt to somersault, twist and pike their way to victory with the help of their coach, Olympic bronze medallist Tom Daley. Comedienne Jo Brand and experts Leon Taylor and Andy Banks pass comment as usual, but who wins is entirely in the hands of viewers. Last in the series

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The love lift delivers a London rugby player, a physiotherapist from Liverpool, a gymnastics coach from Bath and a Glasgow drainage engineer, all of whom are hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show

programme.desc: Including an interview with legendary gymnast Yordan Yovchev, samo wrestling from Burkina Faso, a profile of bobsledder Kaillie Humphries, and a look at the Mexican sport charreria, which is a competitive event similar to rodeo and was developed from animal husbandry practices

programme.title: Terror in the Skies
programme.desc: Aeronautical engineer Brendan Walker looks at how the reliance on increasingly complex technology in planes could cause pilots to make new kinds of errors. He reveals cases where aviators have fallen asleep, suffered emotional breakdowns and even forgotten to land, and visits research centres for an insight into the near misses that can put the lives of passengers in danger

programme.title: Secret Removers

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost meets Jenny and Tony Swift, who have five unruly children ranging in age from nine months to 11 years. Supernanny learns the youngsters are looked after by a number of carers, including their grandmother and a nanny, leading the kids to cause rifts between the adults

programme.title: Baking Mad with Eric Lanlard
programme.desc: The patissier makes peanut butter blondies and jam roly-poly, while Alan, Sally and Zoe compete to make the best gateau

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The programme heads to London, where Phil Spencer tries to persuade a couple searching for a home in Balham to consider other areas if they are to find a property with the kind of space they desire. Kirstie Allsopp also has a location problem, as she helps a woman whose dreams of living near Wimbledon Common seem unrealistic on a budget of Â£180,000. Last in the series

programme.desc: Part one of two.
