Meanwhile, Jack and Karen try to arrange dates for each other. American sitcom, starring Debra Messing

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Part two of two. The group embarks on a road trip in an attempt to help Grace forget about Leo, but Jack and Karen soon get bored with the car journey. Jack spots a man whose face he remembers from an old TV advert, and makes him a tempting offer

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: An offhand comment to the twins' new friend has dire consequences for Ray, who cannot understand why everyone is so upset - but he compounds his error by accidentally repeating the remark to the boy's father. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank puts salt on Marie's home-made lasagne, causing her to think she is turning into a terrible cook, but Ray and Robert discover their father has lost his sense of taste - apparently because of a potency medication he is taking. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle, Doris Roberts, Ray Romano and Brad Garrett

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles takes dancing lessons in preparation for a posh society ball, but his date falls ill at the last minute, so he asks Daphne to go with him instead. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Diane visits Seattle for the opening night of her new play, which turns out to be a mixed blessing for Frasier. Although hurt over being jilted, he still harbours feelings for her - but they disappear once he attends the dress rehearsal. Shelley Long guest stars

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: John Gunn, president of fashion company Mexx Canada, is new to the organisation and determined to shake things up. Working undercover, he is given unprecedented access to what is really happening on the sales floors and in the stockrooms. After hearing staff opinions about head office, he decides to make some changes - and the story of one worker's painful past hits the boss hard

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's Selling Houses
programme.desc: Homeowners in Windsor, Berkshire, look around one another's properties for improvement ideas and then spruce up their own on a Â£1,000 budget, hoping to attract buyers. Nick and Kevin come to realise their ornate and opulent style isn't to everyone's taste, Liz learns she needs to update her family home, while Marilyn faces giving her dining room and kitchen a revamp

programme.title: Channel 4 News Midday Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines and weather

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Dishes include grilled tuna, `kinda' Nicoise salad, Thai chicken laksa and mildly spiced noodle squash broth as Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Eccentric office manager Suze Manning hosts the first party of the week in Brisbane, but her guests are left puzzled by a life-size doll called Gypsy, with whom she engages in one-sided conversations. Unusual food combinations are another cause for confusion as Suze aims for the $2,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Hospital secretary Jacki Derrick hosts the second party in Brisbane, but her competitive edge is blunted by spilled drinks, choking guests and overcooked meat. The chef for the evening hopes her butterscotch schnapps and dessert can put her back in the running after one diner gets more then he bargained for when asked to sniff Suze's perfumed chest

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Cook Gerry Cox presents the third party in Brisbane, and his experience in the kitchen prompts guests to fear for their chances of winning the $2,000 prize. The host is confident his vodka slushie machine and ten-pin bowling alley will win them over, but the generous spread of food proves too much for some of the contestants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Florist Bromwyn Meakins-Lines hosts the fourth party in Brisbane, but her allergies and insistence on preparing a gluten-free menu leave her diners with low expectations for the evening. However, a flower-arranging competition goes down well with her fellow contestants and there is romance in the air ahead of dessert

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Life coach MaryAnn Riddell-Birkbeck hosts the final party in Brisbane, and asks her guests to dress as Oscar winners for the evening. However, there is disappointment at her failure to prepare a menu suitable for Bromwyn's food allergies, while rumours of a romance between two contestants continue. At the end of the night, the winner of the $2,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Richard Arnold in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: In the run-up to Valentine's Day, Noel Edmonds (Mr Val Entine) presents a love-themed edition of the game show in which contestants try to guess the values of mystery boxes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Slate salesman Damion Fearnley hosts the third dinner party in Devon, hoping to impress his guests with a carefully crafted menu of restaurant quality food. No dish is as simple as it sounds, and Damion has given each one his own little twist. Unfortunately for him, two of the diners seem more intent on taking verbal swipes at each other than bites out of his food

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: Brendan takes the tourists for a tennis lesson in Nice, and dreams come true as the group plays with dolphins at a marine park. However, there are more waterworks at the vote, and someone could be waving goodbye to the coach

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mayor Quimby brings election day forward, making Springfield's primary election the first to be held in the country. However, the candidates are so uninspiring that the voters write Ralph Wiggum on the ballot as a joke

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy discovers her newborn son has a serious health condition, and is in urgent need of a bone marrow transplant. However, neither she nor Holly are a match, prompting Mercedes to contact the family of the infant's late father for a solution. Meanwhile, George begs Vincent to change his mind about their future together, and Leela is shocked to find herself waking up in Ziggy's bed - but all is not quite what it seems

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Furniture-maker Jamie Brown has big ideas about turning a colossal Second World War RAF bunker into his new home. However, the Nottinghamshire shelter is completely encased in earth, with no natural light, and the back section is submerged in water, leaving Jamie's wife less than confident about the project. Architect George Clarke helps tackle this huge undertaking and discovers the important role the bunker played in the Blitz

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: New series. Return of the dating show in which singletons meet up with possible partners at a restaurant, hoping to find love. Each person has chosen their date based solely on an internet photograph, and at the end of the meal, they decide whether they want to take things further. Nerves begin to show as Paul worries about his stutter, while others try out `killer' chat-up lines with the ladies

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets Emily, a Croydon girl with stretched earlobes, a huge tattoo on her chest and piercings all over her face and body. Now, Emily is desperate to get her natural look back, but will it be possible? Meanwhile, Jodie, a 23-year-old beautician from Luton, wants to take her body modifications to the next level by getting permanent holes punched through the top of her ears, and Pete has serious regrets about a tattoo that has made him a laughing stock among his friends

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: Short arts film, featuring a bedroom-based opera selfie and an ode to love

programme.title: I Love You Phillip Morris (2009)
programme.desc: A gay conman keeps his criminal career and his sexuality a secret from his family, until he ends up in prison for fraud. While serving his sentence, he falls madly in love with a fellow convict and becomes determined to secure their future together - even if it involves a great deal of criminal activity and several prison breaks. Fact-based romantic comedy drama, with Jim Carrey and Ewan McGregor

programme.title: Keeping Mum (2005)
programme.desc: A well-meaning but dull vicar is kept on his toes by his dysfunctional family. His daughter seems to pick the worst possible boyfriends, and his son struggles to make any friends at all, while his wife is becoming very interested in her debonair golf coach. Thankfully, the arrival of a housekeeper gives the foursome a much-needed wake-up call. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Kristin Scott Thomas, Maggie Smith and Patrick Swayze

programme.title: How to Cope with Death
programme.desc: The Grim Reaper confronts an elderly woman - only to discover she is less than willing to comply. Short animation by Ignacio Ferreras

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Liverpool, where they help two women with their house-hunting. Veronica Wright is a mother of two teenage boys, while Catherine Callaghan plans to set up a therapy business at home, so the experts face a tough challenge bringing the women's different lifestyles together under one roof. Student Kate Harland also receives advice on how to get on the property ladder

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost travels to an island near Seattle, where she meets Ricky and Jenye Young, who refrain from disciplining their three sons to compensate for frequently moving house. This has resulted in the children running wild throughout their home, leaving Jo to provide them with lessons in structure and stability

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Short highlights from Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's adventures at the smallholding, revealing the secrets to whipping up simple culinary treats

programme.title: Channel 4 News

Plus, Christian Jessen visits a residential weight-loss camp in Las Vegas and Emma Woolf continues her investigation into eating disorders, meeting a woman with cerebral palsy who is also battling anorexia

programme.title: Big Ballet
programme.desc: Choreographer Wayne Sleep and prima ballerina Monica Loughman audition the dancers for parts in Swan Lake and the pressure is on to see who is cast as the lead and her evil counterpart. Having whittled down hundreds of contenders to form their unique plus-size ballet company, the coaches realise the enormity of the task ahead, with five months until the curtain goes up. Narrated by Olivia Colman

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper continues her exploration of body modification in the Majorcan party town of Magaluf. She meets Stefan, who got a drunken tattoo and woke up the following morning with an obscene message on his arm about a mysterious man called Barry. She also talks to Jeema, who regrets the small image of a dragon that sits just above her bikini line, and Heather, who plucked her eyebrows so much she doesn't have any left

programme.title: Getting Rich in the Recession
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the booming scrap-metal industry, with access to a scrapyard in Sydenham, south-east London. More than a million tons of electrical waste is thrown away each year, and most of it still works, while old sinks, pots, pans, window frames and chairs are discarded without a moment's thought. There to collect these items are the teams who, through hard graft and a keen eye for an opportunity, are earning a crust due to the soaring cost of metal

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: Random Acts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Gerry Hill hosts the second party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to spice up the competition with an Egyptian-themed feast. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Travel agent Kayleigh Hunt hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, but her Moroccan-themed menu fails to impress the diners when she forgets to cook the main course. With all her guests hungry, she resorts to dressing up in her favourite outfits to keep them entertained

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Web designer Marc Harris hosts the penultimate dinner party in Gloucestershire. He is confident his Spanish menu will win over his fellow diners and is determined to put a halt to Zac's rude behaviour, but his plans go downhill when he makes a mess of his starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Council worker Ameena Cott hosts the final dinner party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress with a glamorous evening, which includes colour co-ordinating her dress to match her dog's outfit and making a birdcage centrepiece from a melon. programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Alison and Matthew Grey, two designers from London with young children, are looking for a new place to live within commuting distance of the city. The couple plan to turn a pumping station into a design haven, but with costs mounting, there's a danger they will have to refinance to finish the build. Architect George Clarke follows their progress

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson walks from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland, exploring the history of Northumbria. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of the ancient kingdom's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity

programme.title: Hostages
programme.desc: When Ellen's sister Lauren turns up unexpectedly at the Sanders' house intending to stay, Duncan forces the surgeon to find a way of getting rid of her sibling without arousing suspicion. Meanwhile, Kramer helps Sandrine find the money she needs to pay off Victor, and Hoffman makes progress with his investigation into Angela's death

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
programme.desc: American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighter's plan to blow up the premiere of a propaganda movie - due to be attended by Hitler himself. Quentin Tarantino's wartime adventure, with Brad Pitt, Melanie Laurent, Diane Kruger, Michael Fassbender and an Oscar-winning Christoph Waltz

programme.title: Benefits Street
programme.desc: The final visit to James Turner Street, in the Winson Green district of Birmingham, following the ongoing challenges its residents face, such as poverty, illiteracy, and drug and alcohol addiction. However, as this documentary reveals there's evidence of a strong sense of community, and proof that small acts of kindness between neighbours can go a long way. Last in the series

programme.desc: An offhand comment to the twins' new friend has dire consequences for Ray, who cannot understand why everyone is so upset - but he compounds his error by accidentally repeating the remark to the boy's father. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's Selling Houses
programme.desc: Homeowners in Windsor, Berkshire, look around one another's properties for improvement ideas and then spruce up their own on a Â£1,000 budget, hoping to attract buyers. programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Cook Gerry Cox presents the third party in Brisbane, and his experience in the kitchen prompts guests to fear for their chances of winning the $2,000 prize. programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under

However, a flower-arranging competition goes down well with her fellow contestants and there is romance in the air ahead of dessert

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Down Under
programme.desc: Life coach MaryAnn Riddell-Birkbeck hosts the final party in Brisbane, and asks her guests to dress as Oscar winners for the evening. However, there is disappointment at her failure to prepare a menu suitable for Bromwyn's food allergies, while rumours of a romance between two contestants continue. At the end of the night, the winner of the $2,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Hollyoaks

However, neither she nor Holly are a match, prompting Mercedes to contact the family of the infant's late father for a solution. Meanwhile, George begs Vincent to change his mind about their future together, and Leela is shocked to find herself waking up in Ziggy's bed - but all is not quite what it seems

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Furniture-maker Jamie Brown has big ideas about turning a colossal Second World War RAF bunker into his new home. However, the Nottinghamshire shelter is completely encased in earth, with no natural light, and the back section is submerged in water, leaving Jamie's wife less than confident about the project. Architect George Clarke helps tackle this huge undertaking and discovers the important role the bunker played in the Blitz

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school

programme.title: First Dates

Nerves begin to show as Paul worries about his stutter, while others try out `killer' chat-up lines with the ladies

Now, Emily is desperate to get her natural look back, but will it be possible? programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: Short arts film, featuring a bedroom-based opera selfie and an ode to love

programme.title: I Love You Phillip Morris (2009)
programme.desc: A gay conman keeps his criminal career and his sexuality a secret from his family, until he ends up in prison for fraud. While serving his sentence, he falls madly in love with a fellow convict and becomes determined to secure their future together - even if it involves a great deal of criminal activity and several prison breaks. Fact-based romantic comedy drama, with Jim Carrey and Ewan McGregor

programme.desc: A well-meaning but dull vicar is kept on his toes by his dysfunctional family. His daughter seems to pick the worst possible boyfriends, and his son struggles to make any friends at all, while his wife is becoming very interested in her debonair golf coach. Thankfully, the arrival of a housekeeper gives the foursome a much-needed wake-up call. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Kristin Scott Thomas, Maggie Smith and Patrick Swayze

Narrated by Olivia Colman

programme.desc: Documentary exploring the booming scrap-metal industry, with access to a scrapyard in Sydenham, south-east London. More than a million tons of electrical waste is thrown away each year, and most of it still works, while old sinks, pots, pans, window frames and chairs are discarded without a moment's thought. There to collect these items are the teams who, through hard graft and a keen eye for an opportunity, are earning a crust due to the soaring cost of metal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Gerry Hill hosts the second party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to spice up the competition with an Egyptian-themed feast. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Travel agent Kayleigh Hunt hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, but her Moroccan-themed menu fails to impress the diners when she forgets to cook the main course. With all her guests hungry, she resorts to dressing up in her favourite outfits to keep them entertained

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Web designer Marc Harris hosts the penultimate dinner party in Gloucestershire. He is confident his Spanish menu will win over his fellow diners and is determined to put a halt to Zac's rude behaviour, but his plans go downhill when he makes a mess of his starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Council worker Ameena Cott hosts the final dinner party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress with a glamorous evening, which includes colour co-ordinating her dress to match her dog's outfit and making a birdcage centrepiece from a melon. programme.desc: Alison and Matthew Grey, two designers from London with young children, are looking for a new place to live within commuting distance of the city. The couple plan to turn a pumping station into a design haven, but with costs mounting, there's a danger they will have to refinance to finish the build. Architect George Clarke follows their progress

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson walks from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland, exploring the history of Northumbria. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of the ancient kingdom's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity

programme.title: Hostages

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
programme.desc: American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighter's plan to blow up the premiere of a propaganda movie - due to be attended by Hitler himself. Quentin Tarantino's wartime adventure, with Brad Pitt, Melanie Laurent, Diane Kruger, Michael Fassbender and an Oscar-winning Christoph Waltz

programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the facts about the 1912 disaster, questioning the accuracy of events portrayed in James Cameron's 1997 film. Key points explored include the vessel's speed when it hit the iceberg, and if the captain was at fault, the reasons for having so few people in the lifeboats and the truth about the ship's riches, supposedly still resting on the bottom of the ocean

programme.title: The Kidnapping of Shergar
programme.desc: In February 1983, Epsom Derby winner Shergar was abducted from his home at the Ballymany Stud in Co Kildare by an armed gang and taken away in a trailer - the racehorse's fate remains a mystery. This documentary traces the life and career of Shergar and speculates on how the crime unfolded, featuring interviews with key witnesses

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Best friends Neil and John took over the Vidella Hotel in Blackpool a decade ago, but their love of practical jokes is beginning to wear thin and falling trade has started to take its toll on them. Alex Polizzi tries to turn their struggling business around, but has her work cut out to prove to the owners that a failing hotel is not a laughing matter

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: Lisa's epilepsy is so severe it could kill her and the frequency of her seizures means she is virtually housebound. Neurosurgeons at Liverpool's Walton Centre offer her the option of brain surgery that represents her last hope of leading a more normal life with her husband and young daughter. Simon has a tumour growing on his pituitary gland that is pressing on his optic nerves and needs an emergency operation to remove it and save his eyesight, but the procedure is highly intricate and could damage his vision

programme.title: The Girl with 90 Per Cent Burns
programme.desc: At the age of 22 months Terri Calvesbert received devastating burns in a house fire - injuries so severe that her rescuers at first mistook her for a charred doll. As she turns 15 and begins to take her future into her own hands, this documentary charts her recovery, including an operation to create a thumb, and follows Terri on a trip to LA to meet other young people with similar experiences. As well as revealing the special bond the teenager shares with her father, the programme includes the first TV interview with her mother Julie, who accidentally started the fire. Here she reveals why she stopped seeing her daughter when she was a toddler and how they are now back in touch

Capitalising on its spooky reputation, Jayne organises ghost tours complete with skeletons and cackling witches, but the themed restaurant menu seems to be scaring off the guests. programme.desc: Sgt Carlin arrests a gang of van thieves and uncovers a major criminal operation in the process, while a late-night compost thief is caught on his way out of the shower. Officers hunt for a trucker wielding a baseball bat who has apparently succumbed to road rage and vegetarian Craggy rides to the rescue of a lorry load of calves on the A46. Elsewhere, Brian cracks down on a barbaric blood sport, Jon faces an unexploded bomb, and two fuel thieves plough straight into the interceptors' precious BMW. Documentary following the work of Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit

Meanwhile, Callum is forced to face the fact Josie is serious about their break-up

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. The safe house is attacked, leaving Vance in hospital and Eli missing, with his bodyguard Amit Hadar dead. The movements of all the Palestinians are accounted for at the time of the attack, making it unclear who was responsible, and Ziva suspects her Mossad replacement Liat is hiding something. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon

programme.desc: A newspaper columnist is uncertain whether to accept her partner's marriage proposal, as she is more concerned with reconnecting with the daughter she gave up for adoption. However, she receives inspiration when a reader contacts her and offers a few words of wisdom. Romantic drama, starring Genie Francis, Ted McGinley, Katie Boland, John Bregar and Genelle Williams

programme.title: World's Toughest Prison
programme.desc: One-off documentary revealing the technological advances that have enabled North Branch Correctional Institute in Maryland, USA, to become one of the most secure prisons in the world, holding more than 1,400 of America's most dangerous convicts. Surprisingly, the building was made possible thanks to historic engineering breakthroughs at four earlier prisons - including the Tower of London and Alcatraz Island - each of which featured an innovation that allowed engineers to build even more secure facilities. Now, with its impenetrable cells able to withstand bomb blasts and technology ensuring dangerous inmates are kept safely away from each other, North Branch may be the toughest yet

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski is pulling a trailer packed with snowmobiles destined for the tiny town of Aklavik in the Northwest Territories and has to cross the frozen delta of the Mackenzie River. In Manitoba, Rick Yemm stops his wagon on a blind corner to take a toilet break without leaving Hugh Rowland much room to squeeze by, putting them both in severe danger

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: The adventurer journeys to a remote part of Leyte, one of the 7,000 tropical islands that make up the Philippines, to spend time with Neil Hoag, a 45-year-old former taxi driver from Florida. Ben joins the coconut farmer and his young family in their hillside bamboo house to experience daily life in a harsh and unforgiving climate, discovering why Neil ditched the hunt for the American dream

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Terrifying animal encounters caught on camera by ordinary people. Seven sharks turn on a free-diving father and son during a spear-fishing trip in Mexico, a 500lb elephant seal reacts violently when it feels intimidated by a wildlife cameraman, and an Arizona woman is rushed to hospital after being bitten by one of the world's deadliest snakes lurking in her back garden. Plus, a journalist makes a lucky escape after being attacked by a supposedly tame lion

programme.title: Street Crime UK
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces across the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to fight the huge rise in street crime. In London, the Met's robbery squads work the streets on a busy Friday night, and with criminals now using motorbikes to get away, cameras help officers identify, track and apprehend offenders. Nick also finds out how pickpockets, scammers and bag thieves use sleight of hand and distraction to relieve people of their valuables

programme.desc: An eccentric scientist sets out to prove his debunked theories on inter-dimensional travel by building a machine to transport him to other universes. Comedy adventure, starring Will Ferrell, Anna Friel and Danny McBride. Edited for language and sexual content

programme.desc: An astronaut crash-lands on a strange planet and is captured and enslaved by the ruling race of highly intelligent apes. Luckily, he is helped by a sympathetic chimpanzee - but then discovers a shocking secret. Remake of the 1960s sci-fi adventure, directed by Tim Burton and starring Mark Wahlberg, Helena Bonham Carter and Tim Roth, and featuring a cameo appearance from the original film's star Charlton Heston. Edited for language and violence

programme.desc: Illusionist Eddie Clark gives Mark free tickets to his final show in the Magic Mansion before he and his partner Paul Madison go their separate ways. However, Paul plans to lay claim to all of their tricks when he goes solo, but an escapology stunt goes wrong and he dies on stage. Mark is unwilling to believe that Eddie could be guilty of murder, and decides to investigate. Guest starring Emma Samms

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A vicious gossip columnist digs the dirt on an ageing film actress, who responds by taking on her most challenging role yet - as a real-life murderer. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Anne Baxter, Mel Ferrer, Kevin McCarthy and multi-Oscar-winning costume designer Edith Head in a guest appearance as herself. Edited for violence

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi travels to Falmouth's Meudon Hotel, which was once a jewel of the Cornish coast but has failed to move with the times, leading to a lack of guests and low profits. Alex soon gets to the root of the family business's problem - 86-year-old Harry Pilgrim's refusal to let go of the reins has left son Mark frustrated in his role as general manager. Alex also believes the old-fashioned decor and unimaginative menu only attracts elderly clientele, so she sets about bringing the hotel into the 21st century. But can she persuade Mark to be more forceful as a leader?

programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben journeys to the foothills of the Indian Himalayas to spend time with 69-year-old former fighter pilot Steve Lall, who has opted for a simple farmer's life in the mountains. Ben gets hands-on with the harsh subsistence lifestyle, ploughing with buffalo, chasing both monkeys and human intruders, and gravedigging

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Zac and Hannah have to decide between their feelings for each other and providing a home for Oscar and Evelyn, who have their first day at their new school. programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Terese refuses to take her job back in favour of a life of domesticity, but agrees to return to work when Lucy helps her realise the Willis family does not need her as badly as she thinks. Mason has a reason to take heart after being rebuked about his behaviour by Imogen, while a despondent Kyle admits to Chris he believes his relationship with Kate is doomed

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. The agents discover he is being targeted by terrorists who have hijacked a shipment of advanced weapons from the army. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Like Mother, Like Daughter (2007)
programme.desc: Premiere. A distraught mother takes matters into her own hands when her teenage daughter goes missing and decides to investigate the case herself. She finds a supportive ally in the girl's college professor, but does not realise he is actually the man who murdered her. Thriller, starring Michelle Stafford, William R Moses and Danielle Kind

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the facts about the 1912 disaster, questioning the accuracy of events portrayed in James Cameron's 1997 film. Key points explored include the vessel's speed when it hit the iceberg, and if the captain was at fault, the reasons for having so few people in the lifeboats and the truth about the ship's riches, supposedly still resting on the bottom of the ocean

programme.title: The Kidnapping of Shergar
programme.desc: In February 1983, Epsom Derby winner Shergar was abducted from his home at the Ballymany Stud in Co Kildare by an armed gang and taken away in a trailer - the racehorse's fate remains a mystery. This documentary traces the life and career of Shergar and speculates on how the crime unfolded, featuring interviews with key witnesses

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Best friends Neil and John took over the Vidella Hotel in Blackpool a decade ago, but their love of practical jokes is beginning to wear thin and falling trade has started to take its toll on them. Alex Polizzi tries to turn their struggling business around, but has her work cut out to prove to the owners that a failing hotel is not a laughing matter

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: Lisa's epilepsy is so severe it could kill her and the frequency of her seizures means she is virtually housebound. Neurosurgeons at Liverpool's Walton Centre offer her the option of brain surgery that represents her last hope of leading a more normal life with her husband and young daughter. Simon has a tumour growing on his pituitary gland that is pressing on his optic nerves and needs an emergency operation to remove it and save his eyesight, but the procedure is highly intricate and could damage his vision

programme.title: The Girl with 90 Per Cent Burns
programme.desc: At the age of 22 months Terri Calvesbert received devastating burns in a house fire - injuries so severe that her rescuers at first mistook her for a charred doll. As she turns 15 and begins to take her future into her own hands, this documentary charts her recovery, including an operation to create a thumb, and follows Terri on a trip to LA to meet other young people with similar experiences. As well as revealing the special bond the teenager shares with her father, the programme includes the first TV interview with her mother Julie, who accidentally started the fire. Here she reveals why she stopped seeing her daughter when she was a toddler and how they are now back in touch

Other adrenaline junkies include kite surfers, white-water kayakers and unroped climbers

programme.desc: Sgt Carlin arrests a gang of van thieves and uncovers a major criminal operation in the process, while a late-night compost thief is caught on his way out of the shower. Officers hunt for a trucker wielding a baseball bat who has apparently succumbed to road rage and vegetarian Craggy rides to the rescue of a lorry load of calves on the A46. Elsewhere, Brian cracks down on a barbaric blood sport, Jon faces an unexploded bomb, and two fuel thieves plough straight into the interceptors' precious BMW. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon

programme.title: World's Toughest Prison
programme.desc: One-off documentary revealing the technological advances that have enabled North Branch Correctional Institute in Maryland, USA, to become one of the most secure prisons in the world, holding more than 1,400 of America's most dangerous convicts. Surprisingly, the building was made possible thanks to historic engineering breakthroughs at four earlier prisons - including the Tower of London and Alcatraz Island - each of which featured an innovation that allowed engineers to build even more secure facilities. Now, with its impenetrable cells able to withstand bomb blasts and technology ensuring dangerous inmates are kept safely away from each other, North Branch may be the toughest yet

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski is pulling a trailer packed with snowmobiles destined for the tiny town of Aklavik in the Northwest Territories and has to cross the frozen delta of the Mackenzie River. In Manitoba, Rick Yemm stops his wagon on a blind corner to take a toilet break without leaving Hugh Rowland much room to squeeze by, putting them both in severe danger

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: The adventurer journeys to a remote part of Leyte, one of the 7,000 tropical islands that make up the Philippines, to spend time with Neil Hoag, a 45-year-old former taxi driver from Florida. Ben joins the coconut farmer and his young family in their hillside bamboo house to experience daily life in a harsh and unforgiving climate, discovering why Neil ditched the hunt for the American dream

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Terrifying animal encounters caught on camera by ordinary people. Seven sharks turn on a free-diving father and son during a spear-fishing trip in Mexico, a 500lb elephant seal reacts violently when it feels intimidated by a wildlife cameraman, and an Arizona woman is rushed to hospital after being bitten by one of the world's deadliest snakes lurking in her back garden. Plus, a journalist makes a lucky escape after being attacked by a supposedly tame lion

programme.title: Street Crime UK
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces across the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to fight the huge rise in street crime. In London, the Met's robbery squads work the streets on a busy Friday night, and with criminals now using motorbikes to get away, cameras help officers identify, track and apprehend offenders. Nick also finds out how pickpockets, scammers and bag thieves use sleight of hand and distraction to relieve people of their valuables

programme.desc: Hapless Charlie Hinton expands his childcare business and sets up a summer camp - but with his new venture facing disaster, he is forced to enlist the aid of his strict father to keep the place running smoothly. programme.title: Land of the Lost (2009)
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist sets out to prove his debunked theories on inter-dimensional travel by building a machine to transport him to other universes. His experiment succeeds, and he ends up stranded in another world inhabited by dinosaurs and all manner of other strange creatures. Comedy adventure, starring Will Ferrell, Anna Friel and Danny McBride. Edited for language and sexual content

programme.title: Planet of the Apes (2001)
programme.desc: An astronaut crash-lands on a strange planet and is captured and enslaved by the ruling race of highly intelligent apes. Luckily, he is helped by a sympathetic chimpanzee - but then discovers a shocking secret. Remake of the 1960s sci-fi adventure, directed by Tim Burton and starring Mark Wahlberg, Helena Bonham Carter and Tim Roth, and featuring a cameo appearance from the original film's star Charlton Heston. Edited for language and violence

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Illusionist Eddie Clark gives Mark free tickets to his final show in the Magic Mansion before he and his partner Paul Madison go their separate ways. However, Paul plans to lay claim to all of their tricks when he goes solo, but an escapology stunt goes wrong and he dies on stage. Mark is unwilling to believe that Eddie could be guilty of murder, and decides to investigate. Guest starring Emma Samms

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A vicious gossip columnist digs the dirt on an ageing film actress, who responds by taking on her most challenging role yet - as a real-life murderer. But when the actress kills her own assistant in error, she looks for a way to shift the blame. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Anne Baxter, Mel Ferrer, Kevin McCarthy and multi-Oscar-winning costume designer Edith Head in a guest appearance as herself. Edited for violence

programme.desc: A marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of the US Army's Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. programme.desc: The funeral of a special agent in Los Angeles leads Shepard on a dangerous covert mission to finish some classified business she began a decade previously in Europe. While investigating a mysterious Russian connected to the past operation, Ziva is unable to shake the feeling that the director is in trouble and does her own undercover work to help. Feature-length edition of the crime drama, starring Lauren Holly, Cote de Pablo and Sean Murray

programme.desc: A single mother moves into a seemingly perfect new home, but her happiness is cut short by strange and terrifying events that suggest the house is haunted. Horror, starring Jeri Ryan and Marianne Jean-Baptiste

programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Rob Brydon, Sandi Toksvig, Fred MacAulay and regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz. The host asks questions on the topic of highs and lows, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is still in turmoil about what she believes she saw, so talks to someone she thinks will understand - but things get a little awkward when Alfie is late for their hospital appointment. Tamwar confides in Shabnam about the future of the market, so she swallows her pride and accepts a job at the Minute Mart. The news that Janine is selling off her share of the restaurant worries Ian, who is desperate to protect his empire, while Billy is devastated that he, Lucy and Danny are now unemployed. However, his Butcher's Joints colleagues have a plan up their sleeve - and it doesn't involve him. Johnny is shocked to find out the identity of his online date

programme.title: Bluestone 42
programme.desc: Nick faces a gruelling challenge with a booby-trapped car bomb, and Simon stands up to his fiancee. Comedy drama about a British bomb disposal unit in Afghanistan, starring Oliver Chris and Stephen Wright. Last in the series

programme.title: Bluestone 42 Christmas Special
programme.desc: New team member Corporal House joins the bomb disposal detachment, but his bold and cheeky attitude quickly gets him on the wrong side of Nick. Meanwhile, Bird receives unexpected news and the team decides to plan a nativity play to celebrate the festive season. Comedy drama, starring Oliver Chris, Matthew Lewis and Katie Lyons

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents

Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Mel Giedroyc, Jason Manford, Sarah Millican, Stephen Mangan, Dermot O'Leary, Charles Dance, Warwick Davis, David Harewood, Bob Mortimer, David O'Doherty and Joanna Scanlan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Last in the series

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic champion Greg Rutherford, broadcaster Kirsty Young, actress-writer Joanna Scanlan and comedian Henning Wehn join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Hollywood prosthetics are used to transform people before they go on their first dates, taking their real looks out of the equation to test whether a match can be found based purely on personality. The real faces of those involved are revealed to viewers after the couples have met. In this episode, an old man attempts to woo a witch on the dodgems while bemused members of the public look on. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Alex the world's fussiest demon undergoes a transformation before looking for romance in a cheese shop, to discover whether taking his real looks out of the equation, a match can be found based purely on personality. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Generation Sex
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter travels to Argentina to unlock the hidden world of one of the country's biggest passions - sex. Arriving in Buenos Aires only days before the Dia de la Primavera festival, which celebrates the first day of spring, she finds signs of sex everywhere, from the music and the partying to the steady stream of customers visiting `Telos', or love hotels. However, it also proves to be a country of contradictions, where such freedoms run up against the power of the Catholic Church

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Mummy's girl Jo and student John head to the island Phuket on their first independent holiday, unaware that their parents will be witnessing their holiday antics - including drinking and partying- first hand

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The residents of Quahog become convinced Stewie is possessed by the Devil, forcing the Griffins to flee to Texas and move in with Lois's sister. The malevolent baby then dresses up as a girl to avoid suspicions about his true identity and enters a local beauty pageant

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The principal of the local school tries to improve test scores by expelling its worst pupils, and Lois is outraged when Chris is the first student to get the chop. Peter's fight with a giant chicken continues - but the pair soon realise they have no idea why they are actually quarrelling

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is embarrassed by Steve's recreational activities, so he takes him to Mexico to teach him how to be more manly - but the plan backfires when they are kidnapped by members of a local drug cartel

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Roger acts as the Smith family therapist under the guise of his alter ego Dr Penguin, but his services are cut short when he is sent to fight in the Iraq War - leaving Klaus with the opportunity to take over his counselling duties

programme.title: Generation Sex
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter travels to Argentina to unlock the hidden world of one of the country's biggest passions - sex. Arriving in Buenos Aires only days before the Dia de la Primavera festival, which celebrates the first day of spring, she finds signs of sex everywhere, from the music and the partying to the steady stream of customers visiting `Telos', or love hotels. However, it also proves to be a country of contradictions, where such freedoms run up against the power of the Catholic Church

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Hollywood prosthetics are used to transform people before they go on their first dates, taking their real looks out of the equation to test whether a match can be found based purely on personality. The real faces of those involved are revealed to viewers after the couples have met. In this episode, an old man attempts to woo a witch on the dodgems while bemused members of the public look on. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Alex the world's fussiest demon undergoes a transformation before looking for romance in a cheese shop, to discover whether taking his real looks out of the equation, a match can be found based purely on personality. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on the big stories dominating the media across TV, online and in print in another edition from 2011, as well as picking up on overlooked items that raise a smile

programme.title: Generation Sex
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter travels to Argentina to unlock the hidden world of one of the country's biggest passions - sex. Arriving in Buenos Aires only days before the Dia de la Primavera festival, which celebrates the first day of spring, she finds signs of sex everywhere, from the music and the partying to the steady stream of customers visiting `Telos', or love hotels. However, it also proves to be a country of contradictions, where such freedoms run up against the power of the Catholic Church

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Adventure game show in which 20 men and women travel to Argentina to compete in physically demanding challenges on a purpose-built obstacle course. With a cash prize at stake, the heat is on and Amanda Byram will be trackside to catch all the action. Presented by Richard Hammond

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: Documentary series following traffic police as they try to enforce the law on some of Britain's busiest and most dangerous highways

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their first academic year, and must decide whether to stay in the teaching profession. Second-year student Chloe faces the dilemma of whether to pursue her ambition to travel, while Nick contemplates leaving Harefield Academy to be closer to his wife-to-be. Meanwhile, the teachers discover if they have made an impact on their students when the exam results are released. Last in the series

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: Hillford Girls Grammar student Ja'mie King competes with rival Erin, and treats her love interest Mitchell, from nearby Kelton Boys Grammar, to a private dance. Comedy, starring Chris Lilley, Lester Ellis Jr and Brodie Dare

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat continues her quest to find Stacey, coming face to face with a young man (guest star Matt Willis) who might just know where her cousin is. Meanwhile, Billy learns Alfie's secret and warns him to come clean to his wife, and Lucy learns a few home truths about Danny. Denise confesses her indiscretion with Fat Boy to Patrick, unaware Shabnam has overheard, and the local traders discuss their plan of action regarding the possible market closure - but Ian, who was supposed to be chairing the meeting, fails to show up

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois campaigns for election as mayor, but is only successful after dumbing down her political views to appeal to the electorate. However, the power of her office soon corrupts her and she begins to accept bribes to buy expensive things for herself. Meanwhile, Peter enjoys all the perks his status as `first lady' of Quahog brings him

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Death grants Peter his wish to go back in time to 1984, but only for one night. Breaking a date with Lois, he decides to socialise with a famous film star. On his return to the present, he discovers his changes to the timeline have had shocking repercussions

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine demands a real holiday when she discovers all the family's previous breaks are actually fabricated memories. Stan agrees to the request, but when his wife decides the resulting vacation is too good to be true, she becomes suspicious. Meanwhile, Roger aspires to become a celebrated actor

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine ignores her husband's objections and buys Steve the dog he has always wanted. However, when a horrific accident leaves the canine in critical condition, a traumatic memory from his childhood leaves Stan unable to turn off life support

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: Hillford Girls Grammar student Ja'mie King competes with rival Erin, and treats her love interest Mitchell, from nearby Kelton Boys Grammar, to a private dance. Comedy, starring Chris Lilley, Lester Ellis Jr and Brodie Dare

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: Andy determines to break up with Shelly and make up with Gwen - while wooing Errol's teacher Melodie at the same time. Meanwhile, Sam tries to ditch her dowdy sponsor, hoping to secure a cool alternative. Comedy, starring Nick Helm, Elliot Speller-Gillott and Daisy Haggard

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their first academic year, and must decide whether to stay in the teaching profession. Second-year student Chloe faces the dilemma of whether to pursue her ambition to travel, while Nick contemplates leaving Harefield Academy to be closer to his wife-to-be. Meanwhile, the teachers discover if they have made an impact on their students when the exam results are released. Last in the series

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Comedy show, hosted by Russell Kane, featuring a blend of stand-up routines. The youth club stages a sex education class, French bon viveur Marcel Lucont recounts some of his earliest memories and East End Cabaret provide an eye-watering tale of how to deal with a stiff situation

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their first academic year, and must decide whether to stay in the teaching profession. Meanwhile, the teachers discover if they have made an impact on their students when the exam results are released. Last in the series

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes
programme.desc: A selection of blunders evident in Hollywood films, presented by Matthew Crosby, Ben Clark and Tom Parry from comedy troupe Pappy's. Featuring foul-ups including camera crews in shot, continuity errors, anachronisms and plot holes

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Clara and the Doctor arrive at a haunted mansion on a desolate moor, where a gifted psychic and a professor are searching for a spirit who is said to have appeared in the building over the years. But the so-called Witch of the Well soon turns out to be more than your average ghost. Jessica Raine (Call the Midwife) and Dougray Scott (Mission: Impossible II) guest star, with Matt Smith and Jenna-Louise Coleman

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Tardis is captured by a spaceship salvage team, sending its systems into meltdown. As the Doctor introduces himself to the motley crew of galactic rag-and-bone men, he realises Clara is still trapped within his malfunctioning ship, so he persuades his new acquaintances to help find her, taking them deep into the heart of his beloved blue box. But their hopes of a straightforward rescue are dashed when it turns out Clara is not the only one down there - and if that weren't bad enough, they only have 30 minutes before the Tardis self-destructs. Matt Smith and Jenna-Louise Coleman star, with Ashley Walters (Inside Men)

programme.title: Enemy of the State (1998)
programme.desc: A chance encounter with an old friend derails a successful lawyer's fast-track career, plunging him headlong into a deadly game of cat and mouse with relentless government agents capable of anticipating his every move. He quickly realises the only way to save his own life is to expose the truths his pursuers seem so intent on covering up, and seeks out a former intelligence agent to take them on at their own game. Thriller, starring Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight and Lisa Bonet

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg goes on a Valentine's Day date with a guy she met online. Lois and Peter spend the day lazing in bed, Brian is visited by all of his former girlfriends and Quagmire is transformed into a beautiful woman

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Chris gets teased at school for his budget-brand trainers, and asks for money to help bring his image up to scratch - but is turned down. He attempts to steal it from his parents, but is forced into a blackmail pact when Meg confronts him and threatens to report his thieving antics. Meanwhile, Stewie and Brian become obsessed with singer Anne Murray

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Russell Kane hosts the comedy show featuring an ensemble of up-and-coming talent, blending stand-up routines, short films, sketches and music. In his latest serving he explains why the British like to be unhappy, and Totally Tom become tour guides. Linda the Make-Up Girl inflicts some unconventional beauty treatments on Marcel Lucont

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan becomes a traffic warden in a bid to be taken more seriously, and suddenly finds himself caught up in allegations of corruption and favouritism. Hayley poses nude for a college art class and is surprised to see Roger is one of the students

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan grows fed up with Hayley and Jeff's lazy behaviour, so he bets them he and Francine can live on the minimum wage for a month. Steve and Roger undertake a mission to test-drive their dream car

programme.title: Sexy Beasts
programme.desc: Hollywood prosthetics are used to transform people before they go on their first dates, taking their real looks out of the equation to test whether a match can be found based purely on personality. Narrated by Susan Calman

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Russell Kane hosts the comedy show featuring an ensemble of up-and-coming talent, blending stand-up routines, short films, sketches and music. In his latest serving he explains why the British like to be unhappy, and Totally Tom become tour guides. Linda the Make-Up Girl inflicts some unconventional beauty treatments on Marcel Lucont

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Former Time Lord Matt Smith and his travelling companion Jenna Coleman take an in-depth look at the programme's development over the past 50 years. They profile 11 incarnations of the Doctor, as well as some of his many sidekicks and adversaries, recalling the most famous scenes, storylines and classic moments. Featuring contributions by David Tennant, Paul McGann, Sylvester McCoy, Noel Clarke, Rick Edwards, Konnie Huq and McFly

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes 2
programme.desc: Comedian Robert Webb uncovers hundreds of gaffes in Hollywood's biggest blockbusters. The programme features continuity errors, historical inaccuracies, crew appearing on camera and booms dropping into shot in films including Avatar, Shutter Island, The Karate Kid, Transformers, Kick-Ass, Robin Hood and Star Trek

programme.title: Meet the Fockers (2004)
programme.desc: A hapless groom-to-be appears to have finally won the approval of his stern prospective in-laws, but faces a new challenge when he takes them on a vacation to Florida to meet his free-spirited sex therapist mother and eccentric house-husband father. The tension rapidly mounts as the mismatched families struggle to get along. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: An unfortunate experience on a tanning bed leaves Stewie convinced he has skin cancer. Meanwhile, Chris discovers rival paper boy Kyle has stolen one of his customers - so Peter beats him up

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire loses his job as a pilot and has trouble finding alternative employment, so Peter and Cleveland hatch a plan to get him reinstated - which entails jeopardising an airliner full of passengers. With the guest voice of Hugh Hefner

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is upset to learn that Lois has slept with his new friend Bill Clinton and decides to retaliate by having an affair of his own - but soon realises he loves her too much to ever be unfaithful. Meanwhile, Lois and Stewie try to potty-train Brian

programme.title: Pain, Pus & Poison
programme.desc: Dr Michael Mosley's three-part documentary exploring the history of medicine concludes as he tells the story of how scientists went from finding antidotes to poisons to applying otherwise dangerous toxins as a cure. He reveals why he believes, of all the natural remedies featured in his scientific tour, the tales of treatments derived from deadly substances are perhaps the most extraordinary he encountered. Last in the series

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Antiques Roadshow's Paul Atterbury recalls the heyday of the great ocean liners, travelling round Britain to reveal a story of design, politics and tragedy as he finds out how these great ships captured the public's imagination. Along the way he uncovers a cinema in Scotland built from the interiors of the SS Homeric, and visits a house in Poole, Dorset, where cabins from the Mauretania have been preserved

programme.title: Danny Baker Rocks the Eighties (A Bit)
programme.desc: The irrepressible radio DJ continues his celebration of the best of British rock music, focusing on the 1980s. He salutes performances by the Clash, Pretenders, Ivor Cutler and Prefab Sprout

programme.title: Danny Baker's Rockin' Decades - The Eighties
programme.desc: The presenter is joined by guests singer Pauline Black, comedian Adam Buxton and journalist Mark Ellen to celebrate British rock music of the 1980s. In a period which saw use of the synthesiser and the arrival of Goths, New Romantics and 2 Tone, the definition of what was encompassed by the genre was often stretched

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe tells the story of the LCVP, the Landing Craft, Vehicle, Personnel, which had a pivotal role in transporting troops during the Second World War, especially for beach landings. The writer and sailor goes aboard one of the few remaining examples to learn how this piece of machinery was developed and how it is best remembered for its part in D-Day. Last in the series

programme.title: Ancient Greece
programme.desc: Classicist Michael Scott looks at the prevalence of theatre throughout Greece as Athens began to decline during the fourth century BC, and how it conceived a new kind of comedy that is still popular today. Featuring contributions by professors Edith Hall and Paul Cartledge

programme.title: Danny Baker's Rockin' Decades - The Nineties
programme.desc: The presenter celebrates British rock as it enters the dance decade of the 1990s. Along with author and musician Louise Wener, comedian Josie Long, journalist Alexis Petridis and a slew of archive clips, the era of `Britpop' and `Madchester' is brought alive. Danny also selects a number of classic performances from the decade. Last in the series

programme.title: Danny Baker Rocks the Nineties (A Bit)
programme.desc: With the help of a couple of morris dancers, the presenter showcases performances by rocking Brits such as the Justified Ancients of Mu Mu, Radiohead, Happy Mondays and Portishead. Last in the series

programme.title: My Son the Fanatic (1997)
programme.desc: A Pakistani taxi driver who emigrated to London has turned his back on traditional Muslim culture, but finds to his dismay that his son is embracing conservative religious attitudes. Feeling like an outsider in his own family, he turns to a friendship with a prostitute hired by a regular client for solace. Drama, starring Om Puri, Akbar Kurtha, Rachel Griffiths and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Mechanical Marvels
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history of the self-operating contraptions known as automata, which were first designed hundreds of years ago but display levels of technical sophistication that continue to amaze many today. Professor Simon Schaffer examines the history behind these clockwork motor-powered machines and the hardship endured by the workers that built them. Travelling around Europe, he visits a functional automaton city, observes a robotic boy that can be programmed to write, and witnesses a device capable of playing chess

programme.title: Ancient Greece
programme.desc: Classicist Michael Scott looks at the prevalence of theatre throughout Greece as Athens began to decline during the fourth century BC, and how it conceived a new kind of comedy that is still popular today. Featuring contributions by professors Edith Hall and Paul Cartledge

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2 Reggae - Stir It Up
programme.desc: Collection of archive performances by artists including Bob Marley & the Wailers, Susan Cadogan, the Specials, Ken Boothe, Steel Pulse, Dave & Ansell Collins, Althea & Donna and Janet Kay. Reggae was imported to the UK by immigrants from the West Indies, and became an established chart presence in the 1970s

programme.title: Danny Baker Rocks the Nineties (A Bit)
programme.desc: With the help of a couple of morris dancers, the presenter showcases performances by rocking Brits such as the Justified Ancients of Mu Mu, Radiohead, Happy Mondays and Portishead. Last in the series

programme.title: Danny Baker's Rockin' Decades - The Nineties
programme.desc: The presenter celebrates British rock as it enters the dance decade of the 1990s. Along with author and musician Louise Wener, comedian Josie Long, journalist Alexis Petridis and a slew of archive clips, the era of `Britpop' and `Madchester' is brought alive. Danny also selects a number of classic performances from the decade. Last in the series

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock joins Chris Lintott and the team as they focus on Jupiter - the largest planet in the solar system. Together they explore what causes the planet's extraordinary weather, and how its coloured bands and iconic `eye' are visible manifestations of a violent atmosphere. Guest reporter and physicist Dr Helen Czerski also explains why the planet looks the way it does

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star. First broadcast October 21, 1984

programme.title: Britain on Film
programme.desc: Documentary examining the fragmentation of the British Empire, revealing how the Rank Organisation's Look at Life series captured the realities of post-Imperialism. Sending film crews to Aden in Yemen, Malaysia and Ascension Island in the Atlantic Ocean, the programme documents the efforts of those helping former colonies adjust to life in the Commonwealth. Last in the series

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: New series. British architects reveal how they helped craft the modern world with their vision, beginning by discussing their latest work including London's `Cheesegrater' skyscraper, Spaceport America in New Mexico and the KK100 in China. Norman Foster, Richard Rogers, Nicholas Grimshaw, Michael Hopkins and Terry Farrell were all born in the 1930s and were shaped by the optimism of the post-war years and the 1960s counter-culture, and began their careers as outsiders and radicals. They tell the stories of the designs for the Pompidou Centre in Paris, Willis Faber & Dumas Headquarters in Ipswich and Hopkins House in Hampstead

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Scientists and researchers analyse discoveries about asteroids, and explain why studies suggest smaller rocks could pose a threat as they head toward Earth. The experts explain the photon propulsion that powers the asteroids on their journey across space, and why some of these travellers carry a cargo of frost and ice that could have helped to start life on the planet

programme.title: Dreaming the Impossible
programme.desc: Architectural investigator Dr Olivia Horsfall Turner reveals the fascinating and dramatic stories behind some of the grandest designs never built. She begins in 1855, when visionary designer Joseph Paxton put forward ambitious plans for the Great Victorian Way, which promised to alleviate congestion in London by encircling the city centre with a 10-mile-long glass structure containing shops, houses, hotels and eight railway lines

programme.title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern
programme.desc: The host (Simon Day) presents his guide to The Life of Rock from prehistoric man to the present day, in a spoof three-part chronology of some of the biggest moments in rock history. In the first episode, Pern examines rock music's prehistoric origins, tries to discover the world's smartest band, and recalls the time he dressed up as a crab

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Maggie Aderin-Pocock joins Chris Lintott and the team as they focus on Jupiter - the largest planet in the solar system. Together they explore what causes the planet's extraordinary weather, and how its coloured bands and iconic `eye' are visible manifestations of a violent atmosphere. Guest reporter and physicist Dr Helen Czerski also explains why the planet looks the way it does

They tell the stories of the designs for the Pompidou Centre in Paris, Willis Faber & Dumas Headquarters in Ipswich and Hopkins House in Hampstead

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions
programme.desc: Aly Bain and Jerry Douglas invite Mary Chapin Carpenter from the US, Irish star Maura O'Connell, Hebridean Julie Fowlis and bluegrass musician Tim O'Brien to perform at the show's new studios overlooking Loch Lomond

programme.title: Sound of Cinema
programme.desc: Neil Brand explores how great film soundtracks work, and reveals that in the second half of the 20th century composers embraced jazz, pop and rock to bring new energy to movie scores. Using the 1960s as an example, he shows how the James Bond features, Italy's spaghetti westerns and Disney's musicals utilised the talents of composers such as John Barry and Ennio Morricone, before the role of a composer changed when directors like Quentin Tarantino began to employ carefully chosen pop songs. With contributions from Martin Scorsese, Richard Sherman, Lalo Schifrin and David Arnold

programme.title: Neil Sedaka
programme.desc: A documentary portrait of the US musician's life and career, in which he had two distinct periods of success. He broke onto the scene in the late 1950s, selling over 25 million records in the space of five years, but his career took a downward turn when the Beatles and the British Invasion hit the States. However he found popularity in the UK in the early 1970s, before returning to his homeland and achieving fresh stardom with famous numbers like Solitaire and Laughter in the Rain. The singer reveals how he created his other catchy classics Calendar Girl, (Is This the Way To) Amarillo, Breaking Up Is Hard to Do, Happy Birthday Sweet Sixteen and Stupid Cupid

programme.title: Neil Sedaka Says
programme.desc: A programme from 1983 looking at the diverse range of hits by the singer, from the rock `n` roll era to a more lyrical age. He performs many of his famous numbers, including Solitaire, Bad Blood, The Hungry Years, Laughter in the Rain and New York City Blues

programme.title: Kings of Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: Celebration of the musical icons of the 1950s, including Bill Haley and the Comets, Chuck Berry, Buddy Holly and Elvis Presley. Featuring some of the more scandalous tales of the era, from Jerry Lee Lewis' marriage to his 13-year-old cousin to the original sexually explicit lyrics of Little Richard's hit Tutti Frutti. Featuring archive footage of the performers and contributions by celebrities including Tom Jones, Paul McCartney, Cliff Richard, Jack White, Jools Holland, Hank Marvin, John Waters and Minnie Driver, who reveal how the songs of the era have inspired them

programme.title: Even More Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances of the most iconic artists and bands from the 1960s and 1970s, featuring Pictures of Matchstick Men by Status Quo, the Who's single Long Live Rock, Tunnel of Love by Dire Straits and Lynyrd Skynyrd's classic Sweet Home Alabama. Plus, rare clips of George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty

programme.title: Neil Sedaka
programme.desc: A documentary portrait of the US musician's life and career, in which he had two distinct periods of success. He broke onto the scene in the late 1950s, selling over 25 million records in the space of five years, but his career took a downward turn when the Beatles and the British Invasion hit the States. However he found popularity in the UK in the early 1970s, before returning to his homeland and achieving fresh stardom with famous numbers like Solitaire and Laughter in the Rain. The singer reveals how he created his other catchy classics Calendar Girl, (Is This the Way To) Amarillo, Breaking Up Is Hard to Do, Happy Birthday Sweet Sixteen and Stupid Cupid

Featuring some of the more scandalous tales of the era, from Jerry Lee Lewis' marriage to his 13-year-old cousin to the original sexually explicit lyrics of Little Richard's hit Tutti Frutti. Featuring archive footage of the performers and contributions by celebrities including Tom Jones, Paul McCartney, Cliff Richard, Jack White, Jools Holland, Hank Marvin, John Waters and Minnie Driver, who reveal how the songs of the era have inspired them

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of South America
programme.desc: Dr Jago Cooper embarks on a journey to discover the history of some of South America's ancient civilisations, beginning with the Chachapoya people of the Peruvian Andes. He reveals how they developed sophisticated methods of recording stories, traded in exotic goods found hundreds of miles from their territory and had funeral traditions that challenge assumptions about past human behaviour

programme.title: Salamander
programme.desc: Pursued by unknown forces, Paul Gerardi takes shelter in the monastery where his former boss Carl Cassimon has retreated, and asks him for help. Meanwhile, his wife and daughter are at breaking point from constant surveillance and mysterious phone calls depriving them of sleep. Belgian thriller, starring Filip Peeters, Mike Verdrengh and Koen De Bouw. In Flemish and French

programme.title: Salamander
programme.desc: Paul flees the monastery and realises that his daughter will be targeted by the government agents, so he rushes to her school, only to discover she has already been taken. Persigal, unsure of whom to trust, meets with Jonkhere, who demands results in identifying the perpetrators of the bank raid. Belgian thriller, starring Filip Peeters, Mike Verdrengh and Koen De Bouw. In Flemish and French

programme.title: Boogie Fever
programme.desc: Steve Wright presents performances of disco classics from the BBC archives, featuring George McCrae, Chic, Gloria Gaynor, Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Edwin Starr, the Weather Girls, Liquid Gold, Heatwave, the Bee Gees, Earth Wind & Fire, Tina Charles, the JALN Band, Hi-Tension, Sylvester, the Village People, Boney M, Linx, Yazz, Infernal, the Three Degrees, Blondie, the Gibson Brothers and Rick Dees and His Cast of Idiots

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Jeff wants to spice up his sex life with Audrey, and Russell dates a girl he knows nothing about. Meanwhile, Jennifer buys Adam a present that causes embarrassment

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Audrey lets her work colleagues believe she is pregnant, and keeps up the ruse when she receives special treatment. Meanwhile, Russell takes Jennifer's Amish friend on a date

programme.title: The Tomorrow People
programme.desc: Stephen breaks Ultra protocol during a training exercise, and Jedikiah's mysterious boss insists on meeting him. Meanwhile, Cara and John debate whether going to a nightclub party is too dangerous, and Astrid finds out what Stephen is really up to. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

Comedy thriller, starring Eddie Murphy, Judge Reinhold, Ronny Cox, John Ashton and Steven Berkoff

Meanwhile, Ted fears being the only single man at the marriage ceremony and staying alone at a romantic hotel. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan
