He launches his new look at an open mic night after taking advice from Sloman, and despite not being able to play the guitar, he gains the support of the crowd and talent manager Terror Moses. Meanwhile, Stefan and Andrew end up going their separate ways after failing to recruit a new member. Comedy, starring Stefan Abingdon, Andrew Wakely and Ashley Horne

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary (2001)
programme.desc: A single woman begins a new year with resolutions to find love, give up her bad habits and step up the career ladder. Her plans crumble as she tries to deal with her mother's infidelity, get over a passionate fling with her boss and come to terms with her feelings for an uptight lawyer. Romantic comedy, based on Helen Fielding's novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The love lift delivers a disco-dancing bachelor from West Yorkshire, a Manchester student, and a stockbroker and a nanny, both from London, all of whom are hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.desc: The mischievous little boy discovers his school is faced with closure and the pupils will be forced to go to an evil headmaster's strict academy. To avoid this fate, he enters into an alliance with his classroom arch-enemy and hatches a plan to save the school. Comedy based on the series of children's books, starring Theo Stevenson, Richard E Grant and Anjelica Huston. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas (2000)
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Rumor Has It (2005)
programme.desc: An obituary writer discovers that her mother and grandmother's affairs with the same young man decades before could have been the inspiration for the book and film The Graduate. Intrigued by the possibility, she sets off for San Francisco to find the charmer who left her relatives reeling. Rob Reiner's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston, Kevin Costner and Shirley MacLaine. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Bridget Jones
programme.desc: The disaster-prone journalist seems to have finally found the perfect boyfriend. However, when the couple start to squabble over their personal habits, she decides to decamp for a while to Thailand and write a travelogue. Unfortunately, she has reckoned without the reappearance of a duplicitous old flame - and a spell behind bars in a Thai prison. Romantic comedy sequel, with Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth, Hugh Grant, Jim Broadbent and Gemma Jones. Including FYI Daily

programme.desc: A trio of lads from Manchester and three Newport girls check into the Lively Hotel, and rep Jordan is thrilled to finally welcome some Welsh guests to Magaluf. programme.desc: A single woman begins a new year with resolutions to find love, give up her bad habits and step up the career ladder. Romantic comedy, based on Helen Fielding's novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth

programme.desc: The love lift delivers a disco-dancing bachelor from West Yorkshire, a Manchester student, and a stockbroker and a nanny, both from London, all of whom are hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents

programme.title: Horrid Henry
programme.desc: The mischievous little boy discovers his school is faced with closure and the pupils will be forced to go to an evil headmaster's strict academy. To avoid this fate, he enters into an alliance with his classroom arch-enemy and hatches a plan to save the school. Comedy based on the series of children's books, starring Theo Stevenson, Richard E Grant and Anjelica Huston

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas (2000)
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski

programme.title: Rumor Has It (2005)
programme.desc: An obituary writer discovers that her mother and grandmother's affairs with the same young man decades before could have been the inspiration for the book and film The Graduate. Intrigued by the possibility, she sets off for San Francisco to find the charmer who left her relatives reeling. Rob Reiner's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston, Kevin Costner and Shirley MacLaine

programme.title: Bridget Jones
programme.desc: The disaster-prone journalist seems to have finally found the perfect boyfriend. However, when the couple start to squabble over their personal habits, she decides to decamp for a while to Thailand and write a travelogue. Unfortunately, she has reckoned without the reappearance of a duplicitous old flame - and a spell behind bars in a Thai prison. Romantic comedy sequel, with Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth, Hugh Grant, Jim Broadbent and Gemma Jones

programme.title: Brides in the Bath
programme.desc: Martin Kemp stars in this one-off fact-based drama set in pre-First World War Yorkshire, telling the story of George Joseph Smith, who used his considerable charm to woo and marry three women at the same time. Unluckily for the ladies in his life, the cad's crimes did not stop at bigamy. All three women had a certain degree of wealth - and all three were doomed to be drowned in their baths by their husband. Co-starring Richard Griffiths and Bad Girls' Tracey Wilkinson, with Emma Ferguson, Jennifer Calvert and Susan Brown

Hospital drama, starring Kananu Kirimi and Robert Cavanah

Remake of the 1970s drama, starring Tom Riley, Trevor Eve, Imogen Poots and Hermione Norris. Last in the series

Gritty drama, starring David Harewood, Philip Glenister, Tamzin Malleson and Tim Pigott-Smith. Last in the series

Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.desc: The murder of two youngsters in ritual slayings lead the police into a case of black magic - and things soon become more incredible, from animal sacrifices and paintings in blood to two of the team apparently cursed by voodoo dolls. Tony remains sceptical throughout - until Alex and her son become the killer's next targets. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib

programme.title: The Wings of the Dove (1997)
programme.desc: An impoverished but calculating Edwardian Englishwoman is desperate for money and status, so she comes up with a scheme to make a fortune by marrying off her lover to a dying heiress. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Hamlet (1990)
programme.desc: A tormented Danish prince seeks revenge on his villainous uncle, who has killed his father, married his mother and usurped the throne. Franco Zeffirelli's adaptation of Shakespeare's tragedy, starring Mel Gibson, Glenn Close, Alan Bates, Paul Scofield, Ian Holm and Helena Bonham Carter. With music by Ennio Morricone. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Partners in Crime
programme.desc: Elegant sleuths Tommy and Tuppence Beresford investigate a case of poisoning at the sinister Thurnley Grange estate, and find that it contains any number of suspects who stand to gain from a woman's death. Starring Francesca Annis and James Warwick

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster teams up with a dashing man to investigate a series of poison-pen letters in the sleepy village of Lymstock. Two of the missives have led to suicides - but Miss Marple suspects there is more to the deaths than meets the eye. Murder mystery with an all-star cast, featuring Geraldine McEwan, James D'Arcy, Emilia Fox, Imogen Stubbs and Ken Russell

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate the death of a maintenance engineer found shot in the head in the basement of the Bodleian Library. A search of the man's house reveals a stash of valuable volumes and a connection to the local Gamblers Anonymous group, and the detectives go on to expose a scam involving two Oxford academics. Drama, guest starring Neil Pearson and Haydn Gwynne, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The glamorous Ruth Van Rydock contacts her old friend Jane Marple with a mystery - her sister Carrie Louise's study has been devastated by a suspicious fire. While Carrie Louise has the same cheerful outlook as ever, Ruth fears dark forces are at play at Stonygates, the home Carrie shares with her third husband, various relatives and a motley crew of young criminals, the latest subject of Carrie's philanthropic endeavours. But on the evening before a theatrical show is staged for their guests, one of whom is Miss Marple, an even more fascinating performance takes place before their very eyes - one where the final act is murder. Julia McKenzie stars, with guest appearances from Joan Collins, Penelope Wilton, Brian Cox, Maxine Peake, Alexei Sayle, Sarah Smart, Ian Ogilvy, Sean Hughes and Nigel Terry

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A woman's body is discovered in Captain Hastings' garage on Bonfire Night. It transpires that the deceased was due to marry an MP - and although the evidence suggests suicide, the Belgian detective suspects foul play. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson star

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The murder of a deaconess who was about to become Oxford's first female chaplain makes Morse wonder whether the city's conservative clerics could be hiding a deadly secret. John Thaw stars, with Kevin Whately and Zoe Wanamaker (My Family)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary investigate the mysterious death of a blind professor caught up in a bitter battle to save his beloved allotment from an unscrupulous land developer. A heady blend of weedkiller, cannabis and high finance hangs in the air as the duo search for clues - and another body is turned up before they track down the villain. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The irascible medic and Louisa embark on what seems to be a perfect first date at a classical music performance in the grounds of a country house, but an inappropriate remark from the doctor kills off any chance of romance. Elsewhere, Al worries that Pauline's gambling is getting out of hand when he finds out that her moped has been repossessed. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of 29-year-old Niall is made difficult by those closest to him, who seem intent on obscuring the facts, and it is not until the body of a drug dealer washes up on a beach that the dreadful truth begins to emerge. While coping with revelations of her own, Vera sifts through evidence of the grief, love and addiction that characterised Niall's life as she tries to find out why someone wanted him dead. With Judy Parfitt (Call the Midwife) and Phyllis Logan (Downton Abbey)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jack is targeted by a murderer as he continues his investigation into the mysterious death of an eminent surgeon - and it looks like the writing may be on the wall for Denton's foremost copper. David Jason, Bruce Alexander and Robert Glenister star

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: The team encounter human trafficking when they investigate a club owner suspected of dealing drugs, but while Adam Parkes seems most likely to crack the case, it's family man Stuart Cole who delivers the vital witness. Hard-hitting drama, starring David Harewood and Jake Nightingale

programme.title: Brides in the Bath
programme.desc: Martin Kemp stars in this one-off fact-based drama set in pre-First World War Yorkshire, telling the story of George Joseph Smith, who used his considerable charm to woo and marry three women at the same time. Unluckily for the ladies in his life, the cad's crimes did not stop at bigamy. All three women had a certain degree of wealth - and all three were doomed to be drowned in their baths by their husband. Co-starring Richard Griffiths and Bad Girls' Tracey Wilkinson, with Emma Ferguson, Jennifer Calvert and Susan Brown

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William is headhunted by a French accountancy firm, and he and Hester decide to move to France. However, the pair soon discover that what divides the British and French is more than just the English Channel. Sequel to Fresh Fields, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield residents are shocked when an MI5 agent turns up in the village showing more than just a passing interest in the activities of Vernon Scripps and his mysterious associate, a man who disembarked from a Russian trawler docked in Whitby harbour. It seems there is an even darker side to the roguish wheeler-dealer than they suspected

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwin and Makori work through the night to save a toddler diagnosed with meningitis, while a dying mother worries that her alcoholic husband will not be able to care for their children after she is gone. Meanwhile, Nkeshi's future may be decided by a job offer in Cameroon

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A Belgian film star arrives in London and summons her friend Poirot to unravel the mysterious threats she has been receiving, which demand the return of a priceless diamond, the Western Star. Rosalind Bennett guest stars

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica impersonates an old friend to track down a hit-and-run driver and uncovers a sordid tale of blackmail, theft and murder. Drama starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Captain Jack Crocker, a robust seafaring man, is implicated in the murder of beautiful aristocrat Lady Brackenstall's abusive husband. Drama, guest starring Oliver Tobias, with Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke and Anne Louise Lambert

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's staff come under suspicion when some African carvings are stolen from the hall - but then an African chieftain arrives claiming the very same pieces belong to his tribe. Vernon sees a business opportunity that needs the royal stamp of approval and probationary PC Tom Nicholson turns up at the station. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Rupert Vansittart and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Joan bids a fond farewell to her friends at the hospital, but a last-minute intervention by her mother makes her reconsider her decision to leave. Meanwhile, Carnegie courts a wealthy patient in the hope of raising funds for the new hospital wing, and an alcoholic lets his family down at the worst possible moment. Hospital drama, starring Kananu Kirimi and Robert Cavanah

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William and Hester tell daughter Emma about their decision to move to France, and set about finding somewhere suitable to live. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: The hotel throws a fancy dress occasion and guests are invited to provide the entertainment. The Pearces and the Cochrans perform their party pieces. Eighties sitcom about two couples who meet on a Spanish package holiday, with Keith Barron, Gwen Taylor, Neil Stacy, Joanna Van Gyseghem

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Eagle-eyed George sees an investment opportunity when Mildred suggests their dog should have puppies. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's staff come under suspicion when some African carvings are stolen from the hall - but then an African chieftain arrives claiming the very same pieces belong to his tribe. Vernon sees a business opportunity that needs the royal stamp of approval and probationary PC Tom Nicholson turns up at the station. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Rupert Vansittart and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A Native American arrives in Jessica's beloved Cabot Cove, claiming the whole town and its surrounding area belongs to him, and clutching a land grant to prove it. When a local industrialist is found murdered soon after, all signs point to the newcomer being the culprit. Drama, starring Angela Lansbury and Tom Bosley

programme.title: Doc Hollywood (1991)
programme.desc: An arrogant doctor on his way to California causes an accident in a rural South Carolina town and is sentenced to community service at the local hospital. Initially desperate to leave, he gradually comes to appreciate a slower pace of life. Comedy, starring Michael J Fox, Julie Warner, Woody Harrelson, Bridget Fonda and George Hamilton

programme.title: Bouquet of Barbed Wire
programme.desc: Gavin's personal quest for the truth nears its conclusion, forcing Peter to face a dark secret from his past that sheds a disturbing light on his love for Prue. As the net begins to close, the Mansons are forced to acknowledge a truth that could destroy their lives for ever. Remake of the 1970s drama, starring Tom Riley, Trevor Eve, Imogen Poots and Hermione Norris. Last in the series

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Ambitious Chief Inspector Frank Vickers realises rookie cop Lorraine Johnstone's relationship with a pimp could do irreparable damage to the team's reputation and credibility if it becomes widely known. Determined to protect himself at all costs, he attempts to sacrifice her while there's still time, making Inspector Joe Robinson realise the full extent of his corruption. Gritty drama, starring David Harewood, Philip Glenister, Tamzin Malleson and Tim Pigott-Smith. Last in the series

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. A friend of DCS Walker, the well-known paediatric surgeon Jonathan Carlisle, is found dead. When Connor investigates, she discovers a recent operation performed by the doctor resulted in a girl's death and that the surgeon had a restraining order issued against her grieving father. A game of cat and mouse ensues to find the prime suspect - leading to a tense face-off at the zoo. John Lynch, Benedict Taylor and Ben Miles guest star

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Captain Jack Crocker, a robust seafaring man, is implicated in the murder of beautiful aristocrat Lady Brackenstall's abusive husband. Drama, guest starring Oliver Tobias, with Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke and Anne Louise Lambert

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A spate of petty thefts is traced to a local nursing home, but Blaketon's investigations uncover something far more sinister. Meanwhile, David's first day in his new job goes spectacularly wrong, but Bernie is not surprised. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A mix-up over the job offer results in two new doctors arriving at the hospital to take up the position. Meanwhile, Catherine makes her feelings clear to Carnegie about their relationship and Stella's night out ends badly. Hospital drama, starring Robert Cavanah

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: Hestor and William find the move to France quite an ordeal as she misplaces their passports and he forgets to drive on the right. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill and Faith crave privacy and romance, but cannot seem to find time for each other in between the demands of two teenage children and an interfering ex-wife. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper is astonished and thrilled when George buys her an expensive present for their anniversary. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A spate of petty thefts is traced to a local nursing home, but Blaketon's investigations uncover something far more sinister. Meanwhile, David's first day in his new job goes spectacularly wrong, but Bernie is not surprised. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The residents of Cabot Cove become concerned when a Native American appears with a property grant stating that the whole town and its surrounding land belong to him. A tale of infidelity, theft and blackmail unfolds as Jessica testifies at the trial of an old friend accused of murder. Janet Leigh guest stars, alongside Angela Lansbury

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: The murder of two youngsters in ritual slayings lead the police into a case of black magic - and things soon become more incredible, from animal sacrifices and paintings in blood to two of the team apparently cursed by voodoo dolls. Tony remains sceptical throughout - until Alex and her son become the killer's next targets. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib

programme.title: The Wings of the Dove (1997)
programme.desc: An impoverished but calculating Edwardian Englishwoman is desperate for money and status, so she comes up with a scheme to make a fortune by marrying off her lover to a dying heiress. Romantic period drama adapted from the novel by Henry James, starring Helena Bonham Carter, Linus Roache, Michael Gambon and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An intruder begins breaking into people's homes and destroying their plaster statuettes of Napoleon, but leaving more valuable items untouched. Holmes resolves to find out why, eventually uncovering a twisted tale of theft and murder, Starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ashfordly Hall throws open its doors to the public, but all hell breaks loose when a collection of valuable Constable sketches is stolen. Mike and Tom are sent to question the chief suspect, an 80-year-old art thief, only to find him mugged and bound to a chair - with none of the paintings anywhere in sight. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr and Ryan Early

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: An expectant mother attends for treatment, but is harassed by her former husband. Stella is relieved to find she has not contracted an infection from her attacker, but suffers accusations of lying to save her reputation. Meanwhile, Sister Brigid makes a misguided suggestion, and a surprise visitor from overseas forces Goodwin to reconsider his future plans

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: English country squire Marcus Waverly receives a series of anonymous letters threatening to kidnap his son Johnnie, but the case is dismissed by Scotland Yard - prompting Poirot to open his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet and Geoffrey Bateman

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: While William prepares for his first day of his new job, Hester faces the prospect of dealing with a French plumber and is later caught off-guard by an unexpected visitor. Comedy, with Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Faith decides to thank Bill for dinner, but inviting him round to meet her children may not be the best way to express her gratitude. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mrs Roper goes into hospital with suspected appendicitis and George looks forward to some peace and quiet - but Jerry shows up on his doorstep with other ideas. Roy Kinnear guest stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ashfordly Hall throws open its doors to the public, but all hell breaks loose when a collection of valuable Constable sketches is stolen. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr and Ryan Early

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The sheriff is landed with the job of entertaining his sister when she leaves her husband. However, the situation is complicated when his brother-in-law is murdered, leaving Jessica with a conundrum to solve. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury and Henry Gibson

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William is distraught to learn his mother has suffered a serious stroke, and rushes to the nursing home to see her, arriving just before she dies. Admitting their relationship was not always a happy one, he resolves nevertheless to give her a send-off she would be proud off - only to receive shocking news at the reading of her will. Elsewhere, Molly strives to make amends with Mary, but she has enough to worry about in the form of a teenage girl about to give birth. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William becomes convinced Mary is involved with Reuben, and arrives at her flat hoping to catch them red-handed - only to discover he has got it all wrong. Unable to cope with the subsequent embarrassment, he ends their relationship and considers selling his business and making a fresh start in New Zealand, but Mary hears of his plans and rushes round, shocking him with a marriage proposal. Will love finally conquer all for the off-on couple? Romantic drama, starring, Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Paterson Joseph, Cheryl Campbell and Michael Begley

programme.title: Meet Joe Black (1998)
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a doctor and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani

programme.title: River Monsters

Nevertheless, the loyal nephew sets out to track down the so-called Goodtime garage to provide corroboration. Lighthearted drama, with George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Cliff is goaded into riding a mechanical bull, while Woody tries to impress Kelly's mother, who responds by making advances toward him. Comedy, starring Woody Harrison

programme.title: Cheers

programme.title: Police Academy (1984)
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Extreme Measures (1996)
programme.desc: A promising young doctor is shocked to learn a respected neurologist may be carrying out illegal experiments on homeless patients in a risky attempt to find a cure for paralysis. However, when he decides to take action, he underestimates the danger he is putting himself in. Thriller, starring Hugh Grant, Gene Hackman, Sarah Jessica Parker, David Morse and Bill Nunn. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: The Story of Dr Wassell (1944)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War adventure based on the true story of an Arkansas medic who saved the lives of Navy personnel in Java during the Pacific War. Starring Gary Cooper, Laraine Day and Signe Hasso. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex (1958)
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Superman (1978)
programme.desc: A fledgling superhero crash-lands on Earth after evacuation from his home planet and is taken in by an elderly couple who raise him as their own. But with adolescence comes a greater understanding of his superhuman powers, leading to his rebirth as a crusader for justice and defender of the American way of life. Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Hornblower
programme.desc: The newly promoted lieutenant accepts a diplomatic commission as the war reaches a stalemate, and finds himself on French soil in the midst of a daring plot to overthrow the government. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Robert Lindsay and Antony Sher

programme.title: Rambo III (1988)
programme.desc: Vietnam veteran John Rambo turns down a request from his old colonel to join a mission in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. However, when the officer is captured, Rambo sets off to save him, joining the Mujahedeen rebels in fighting against the Russian invaders. Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Kurtwood Smith, Marc de Jonge and Sasson Gabai. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Whisker Wars
programme.desc: There is just one more contest before the finals - the German National Beard and Moustache Championships, in which Jack Passion and Aarne Bielefeldt are taking part. programme.title: Cheers

Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews

Comic-strip adventure, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Margot Kidder and Marlon Brando

Morgan starts sleeping on Ellie and Awesome's couch, but the arrangement comes to an abrupt end when Ellie discovers her lodger sleeps in the nude

programme.title: Lone Rider (2008)
programme.desc: A veteran of the American Civil War returns to his home town to discover a former friend, who has become a ruthless land baron, is intent on seizing his father's ranch, forcing the hardened soldier to take up arms once more to protect his family and property. Western, starring Lou Diamond Phillips, Vincent Spano and Stacy Keach

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Drama following the fortunes of Olivia Lockhart, a small-town judge, both inside and away from the courtroom. As the tale gets under way, Olivia considers a career move that could cost her a new romance, and force her to leave behind the home she has come to love

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI tries to solve the murder of a Santa Claus impersonator, and Jane is questioned by an independent investigator in connection with the death of cop-killer Todd Johnson, who was set on fire while in police custody. Drama, starring Simon Baker, Robin Tunney, Owain Yeoman and Amanda Righetti

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A notorious drug dealer is murdered and suspicion falls on two possible culprits - a priest with a reputation as a vigilante, and the father of a teenager who died of an overdose. Briscoe and Green attempt to discover whether either of them took the law into his own hands. Starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Three women dressed identically as the Breakfast at Tiffany's character Holly Golightly rob a jewellery store and kill a salesman in the process, triggering an inquiry that leads the team into the murky world of illicit diamond trading. Meanwhile, Mac and Peyton investigate the discovery of a mummified corpse in a condemned building. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A man dressed in a superhero costume is found dead in an alley, and Mac, Stella and Dr Hawkes are taken aback to discover his everyday clothes in a nearby phone booth. Meanwhile, Danny and Lindsay investigate the murder of a promising NFL footballer. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes, Carmine Giovinazzo and Eddie Cahill

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called to the hospital after the reported rape of a 10-year-old girl, who is so traumatised she won't speak at first, but eventually reveals that the attacker took pictures of her. A media frenzy is sparked when another victim comes forward and the detectives once again cross paths with Erik Weber, the leader of anti-paedophile vigilante group COAP, who points the finger at church warden Edwin Adelson. Guest starring Henry Ian Cusick and Stephen Tobolowsky

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: An explosive gangland hit sends rookie officer Jesse Calvert back to his underworld roots to find the supplier of the deadly assault rifles used in the shooting. He reconnects with an old friend, gang member Isaac Tibbs, whose sister Heather was killed in the incident - but as he tries to re-establish his street cred with their new leader, Monk, the young officer learns a tough lesson about operating undercover

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: The sheriff investigates when a man is killed by a wild bear, while Branch has to deal with his gun-toting uncle causing trouble at the retirement home. Peter Weller guest stars

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Danny gets trapped in a panic room with a murder victim, forcing Stella to help devise a way to preserve any evidence and secure his release before the body decays too much and the oxygen supply runs out. Meanwhile, Mac, Dr Hawkes and Lindsay are called to investigate the killing of an exotic dancer whose corpse was discovered on a stage light

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Fighter Attack (1953)
programme.desc: An American pilot returns to Italy after the Second World War and tells a priest the story of his last mission. He reveals how he was shot down in German occupied territory, but received help from a band of Partisan guerillas who helped him to free a captive friend and escape back to their own lines. Drama, starring Sterling Hayden and J Carrol Naish

programme.title: Thunder Over the Plains (1953)
programme.desc: An officer in the Union army occupying post-Civil War Texas is charged with enforcing law over his own people. Setting out in pursuit of a gang of vigilantes, he begins to sympathise with their plight and when the leader is arrested on a trumped-up murder charge, he tries to prove his innocence, becoming a wanted man in the process. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Lex Barker, Phyllis Kirk and Elisha Cook Jr

programme.title: Man from God's Country (1958)
programme.desc: A trigger-happy sheriff is forced out of office and decides to visit an old friend in a frontier town - but finds he has fallen victim to a corrupt freight magnate and vows to help him fight back. Western, starring George Montgomery, Frank Wilcox, Kim Charney and Susan Cummings

programme.title: The Vikings (1958)
programme.desc: A Norse warrior becomes embroiled in a feud with a former slave over the succession to the Northumbrian throne, unaware his arch-enemy is really his half-brother. Matters come to a head when they both set their sights on a Welsh princess, leading to a confrontation - but the situation is further complicated by the interference of England's sadistic king. Adventure, with Kirk Douglas, Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, Ernest Borgnine and James Donald

programme.title: Attack on the Iron Coast (1968)
programme.desc: A Canadian major leads a commando attack against a German naval base on the French coast. However, his troubled past and conflict with a fellow officer place the operation in jeopardy, leaving them battling to put their personal problems aside and focus on survival. Second World War drama, starring Lloyd Bridges, Andrew Keir, Sue Lloyd and Mark Eden

programme.title: Mercenary for Justice (2006)
programme.desc: A soldier for hire vows to look after the wife and son of a dead comrade-in-arms, but the family is kidnapped by a rogue CIA faction. The mercenary is forced to carry out a dangerous mission to break into a notorious South African prison and free the son of an arms dealer. Action thriller, starring Steven Seagal, Jacqueline Lord, Roger Guenveur Smith and Luke Goss

programme.title: Kill Switch (2008)
programme.desc: A serial killer has the people of Memphis city living in fear of their lives, until a renowned homicide detective is assigned the task of bringing his reign of terror to an end. He also has to contend with a second homicidal maniac, as well as an FBI agent who does not approve of his brutal methods. Action thriller, starring Steven Seagal, Holly Elissa Dignard and Chris Thomas King

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Dr Kelso suspects a clothes thief is at work, leaving the team dressed in brown scrubs until the mystery is solved. Dr Cox makes a bid to convince Elliot that a reformed drug addict is not as clean as they thought

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Part one of two. A member of staff falls into a coma, putting Dr Cox and Nurse Roberts' debate about destiny into perspective. Keeping a watchful eye on the NannyCam, Carla realises just what a distraction Isabella's beautiful new babysitter is proving for Turk, while Elliot and the Janitor cheer up a dying patient, but leave Dr Kelso feeling undermined

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Nurse Roberts' condition deteriorates, the team begins to deal with the possibility that she could die. Carla finds comfort from an unlikely source, and JD resorts to childish mischief - until he makes a mature bid to be godfather to Dr Cox and Jordan's new baby. Comedy, starring Zach Braff

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: The colleagues reflect on their own lives after Nurse Roberts' death. Dr Cox takes time to consider his purpose and Elliot opens up to Keith, while JD and Turk learn a lesson in compassion. Comedy, starring Zach Braff

programme.title: A Very Brady Sequel (1996)
programme.desc: The eternally cheerful Brady family's easy-going lives are thrown into upheaval by a man claiming to be wife Carol's supposedly dead first husband. The naive clan welcomes him into their home, blissfully unaware he is really a thief planning to steal a priceless artefact - if the sheer niceness of his hosts does not drive him mad first. Comedy, with Shelley Long, Gary Cole and Tim Matheson

programme.title: Short Cuts (1993)
programme.desc: The lives of various suburbanites, ranging from psychotic bakers and philandering traffic cops to children's entertainers and telephone sex-line girls, overlap during one long, hot LA summer. programme.title: Nightline
programme.desc: An incisive late-night news series that analyzes the day's top stories with interviews and reports. It occasionally features program-length documentaries, weeklong series and town-hall forums. The program began in November 1979 as 'The Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage', with Frank Reynolds anchoring. Ted Koppel took over shortly thereafter and it expanded its scope (and took the name 'Nightline') on March 24, 1980. Koppel served as anchor until 2005, when he was replaced by a troika of hosts

programme.desc: Renovation projects are undertaken to demonstrate home repair and building techniques in this Emmy-winning how-to program. Original host Bob Vila was replaced in 1989 after producers objected to his commercial endorsements. Steve Thomas took over until 2003, when he was replaced by Kevin O'Connor. Ace carpenter Norm Abram has been a staple of the show since its inception. Spin-offs include 'Ask This Old House,' while vintage episodes air on HGTV as 'This Old House Classics.'

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia

programme.title: Let's Make a Deal

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: 'Come on down!' Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972, though it originated with Bill Cullen on NBC (1956-63) and ABC (1963-65). However, it was the genial, ageless Barker who really sold viewers on the show, which spawned several syndicated offshoots and a string of prime-time specials. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes

programme.sub-title: The Gang Finds a Dumpster Baby
programme.desc: In the third-season opener, Dennis, Dee and Mac find a baby in a Dumpster, and Dee and Mac decide to raise him. They also decide to use him to raise some cash. Meanwhile, Dennis joins an environmental-activist group, and isn't exactly welcomed with open arms. But he finds a way to take revenge. And Charlie wants Frank to take a DNA test to determine whether they're father and son. Frank won't do that, but he's happy to join Charlie on Dumpster-diving expeditions

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.desc: Mac, Dennis and Dee try out for the Philadelphia Eagles, but seem more interested in outdoing each other. Also trying out for the team is Doyle McPoyle, a brother of the gang's archenemies, Ryan and Liam McPoyle. The entire McPoyle clan shows up to cheer Doyle on, which is not good news for fellow tailgaters Frank and Charlie

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.desc: The McPoyles invade Paddy's and take the gang hostage, demanding $100,000, a gassed-up boat and a reversible Planet Hollywood jacket. Meanwhile, Frank is crawling through the ductwork above Paddy's, searching for his will, when Liam McPoyle turns up the heat

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.sub-title: Dennis and Dee's Mom Is Dead
programme.desc: Dennis and Dee's abrasive mother has died, and the bad news is that she stiffed them in her will, leaving all her money to her humanitarian paramour, Bruce Mathis (Stephen Collins). But at least Dennis got her house. It's a “party mansion,” and that's how he intends to use it

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.sub-title: The Gang Solves the North Korea Situation
programme.desc: The gang declares war on a Korean restaurateur who threatens to bump Paddy's from its coveted and profitable spot on the city's annual pub crawl. Meanwhile, Dee is determined to hold a talent show, primarily because she wants to win it

programme.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
programme.sub-title: The Aluminum Monster vs. Fatty McGoo
programme.desc: Dee gets a rude awakening when she discovers that “Fatty Magoo,” an overweight loser from her high-school class, is now a svelte, successful clothing-store owner. So Dee decides to design a dress for her, but Dennis decides that he's the better designer. He also knows that he has the charm to sell it to Fatty (Judy Greer)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: Templar Code

programme.title: The Dark Ages
programme.desc: Examining Europe's grim six-century-long period marked by famine, plague, persecutions and a persistent state of war that began with the fall of Rome in the fifth century A.D., and ended with the first Crusade. Also explored are the historical figures, including Clovis, Charles Martel, Alfred the Great, Charlemagne and St. Benedict, who brought stability and order to civilization during the era. Also explored are the period's political and cultural ideas that would shape Europe in the future
